Center"
"Trevor Ariza
                 
                 
                      - F -  Rockets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Trevor Ariza scored 15 points with five rebounds, one assist and three triples in 31 minutes vs. the Spurs on Monday.
        
        
             That's more like it. Ariza entered this contest hitting just 1-of-16 from 3-point range in his previous three games, but he found his rhythm tonight and finished 5-of-9 from the field and 3-of-7 from deep. He has early-round upside when his shot is falling, but things can get pretty ugly when it isn't. He gets a matchup with the Clippers on Thursday.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:27 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Eric Gordon
                 
                 
                      - G -  Rockets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Eric Gordon returned to the bench with the return of James Harden on Monday and missed all seven of his shots, finishing a 109-93 blowout win over the Spurs with just one point in 23 minutes.
        
        
             Gordon was playing well, scoring between 14 and 29 points in his last six games, but the return of Harden combined with Gordon's shot not falling resulted in fantasy disaster. Gordon should bounce back and have some good games down the stretch, as he was playing well off the bench with Harden in the lineup previously, but with guys like Harden, Chris Paul, Trevor Ariza and Clint Capela doing the heavy lifting in Houston, Gordon has the potential for low-scoring games at any time. Additionally, while tonight was likely just a fluke, owners have to hope this isn't the start of a shooting slump for Gordon.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:25 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"James Harden
                 
                 
                      - G -  Rockets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            James Harden (knee) returned from a one-game absence and hit 6-of-17 shots and 14-of-14 free throws on his way to 28 points in Monday's 109-93 win over the Spurs.
        
        
             The score got out of hand early, so Harden got some valuable rest for his knee down the stretch. He added six rebounds, six assists, two triples and three turnovers, and he may have already won the free throw category for his owners on the first day of the week. The Rockets still have a 2.0 game lead over the Warriors for the top seed out West and Harden is locked in as a top-5 fantasy asset regardless of the format, assuming his knee doesn't act up again.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:20 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Pau Gasol
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Pau Gasol played just 15 minutes and hit 1-of-5 shots for four points, four rebounds and one assist in Monday's blowout 109-93 loss to the Rockets.
        
        
             Yuck. Gasol has scored a grand total of 14 points in his last three games and had a DNP last Thursday. He's been a fantasy disaster for the last four games for the Spurs, but if they're going to make the playoffs, he's going to have to step up the rest of the way. If the playoffs started tomorrow, the Spurs would be out, so don't be surprised if Gasol plays heavy minutes and starts producing again immediately. Having said that, he's still not the most trustworthy guy, especially playing for Gregg Popovich and dealing with a sore shoulder. But the bottom line is that they need Gasol to start going off if they're going to make the playoffs.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:16 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Dillon Brooks
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dillon Brooks scored 16 points vs. the Bucks on Monday, adding one assist, one steal and two triples in 30 minutes.
        
        
             He finished 7-of-13 from the field and continues to pick up the slack for a Memphis team that has been hit by the injury bug. Andrew Harrison (wrist) still isn't close and who knows when Tyreke Evans (ribs) will be back, so Brooks will continue to provide scoring for his fantasy owners. He's currently having arguably the best stretch of his season, averaging 20.2 points, 2.8 rebounds, 1.2 assists and 2.4 triples over his last five games.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:15 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Rudy Gay
                 
                 
                      - F -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Rudy Gay hit 6-of-15 shots and a 3-pointer for 13 points, five rebounds and nothing else in Monday's 109-93 loss to the Rockets.
        
        
             Gay was the only Spurs' starter in double digits, as Kyle Anderson scored six with an empty line, Pau Gasol had four points and four boards in just 15 minutes, Patty Mills had three points in nine minutes, and Dejounte Murray had seven points, four boards, three assists and a steal in 20 minutes. Even with the Spurs fighting for their playoff lives, Gregg Popovich is still completely unpredictable, and with Kawhi Leonard reportedly returning this week, Gay's value will be iffy going forward. But given the fact that he's one of just a few fully healthy Spurs, Gay should continue to see about 25 minutes a night, with or without Leonard.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:13 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Terrance Ferguson
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Terrance Ferguson returned from the concussion protocol and played 11 minutes on Monday, finishing with three points and a block.
        
        
             He missed Saturday's game, but appears to be over the concussion and ready to go. With the addition of Corey Brewer to the Thunder, Ferguson has no fantasy appeal.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:08 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Marc Gasol
                 
                 
                      - C -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marc Gasol returned from a day of rest on Monday vs. the Bucks with 17 points in 31 minutes, but it wasn't enough as the Grizzlies dropped their 18th straight game.
        
        
             You can see the frustration all over his face and he even heaved up a 3-pointer from nearly halfcourt early in the shot clock. However, he played well for the most part, hitting 8-of-17 shots with seven rebounds, three assists, one steal and one block. The Grizzlies have made it painfully obvious that they are tanking, so Gasol's owners will have to constantly be on the lookout for DNPs.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:06 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Russell Westbrook
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Russell Westbrook hit 7-of-19 shots and two 3-pointers for 17 points, 10 rebounds and 11 assists, recording his 20th triple-double of the season and the 99th of his NBA career in Monday's win over the Kings.
        
        
             The Thunder are hanging in the playoff hunt in the West, but their schedule's about to get very difficult and the Thunder will rely on Westbrook heavily down the stretch. He should be highly motivated to get his 100th triple-double against the lowly Hawks on Tuesday, but the Thunder will likely win that one in a landslide, meaning Westy might not play the fourth quarter. After the Hawks, the Thunder's next 11 games will come against teams in, or just on the brink of, the playoffs. And that's when Westbrook should really take off.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:02 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Jarell Martin
                 
                 
                      - F -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jarell Martin (right foot) started at small forward on Monday vs. the Bucks, scoring 16 points with five assists, four rebounds, one block and one triple in 29 minutes.
        
        
             It's a strange decision for Memphis to go back to their 3-big lineup of Martin, JaMychal Green and Marc Gasol, but Martin's owners aren't complaining because it widens his path to minutes. He's played 29 minutes in three straight games since returning from injury, averaging 14.0 points, 4.0 rebounds, 2.7 assists, 0.7 blocks and 0.7 triples. He's getting the job done for deep-league owners and it helps that the Grizzlies are going to rest Marc Gasol quite a bit.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 11:00 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Paul George
                 
                 
                      - F -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Paul George hit 7-of-18 shots and four 3-pointers for 21 points, six rebounds and five assists in Monday's win over the Kings.
        
        
             PG-13 hit just 4-of-16 shots on Saturday, scoring 11 points with 10 rebounds and a full stat line, and while his overall stat line had some holes in it tonight, but he bounced back nicely from Saturday's poor offensive performance. The Thunder have to keep winning games and have a tough remaining schedule, so George is going to have to finish strong if the Thunder are going to make the playoffs.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 10:56 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Ben McLemore
                 
                 
                      - G -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Ben McLemore returned to the bench on Monday vs. the Bucks, but kept his foot on the gas with 16 points,  three rebounds, two assists, one block and three 3-pointers.
        
        
             He finished 6-of-9 from the field, split a pair of free throws and did all his damage in just 22 minutes. McLemore is having one of his best stretches of the season with averages of 14.6 points, 5.4 rebounds, 2.2 assists, 1.8 steals and 2.0 triples in his previous five March games. With the Grizzlies depleted by several injuries to their backcourt, McLemore is worth a look in deeper leagues if you want to ride the hot hand. The Grizzlies are off until Thursday and only have two more games this week, though.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 10:54 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Corey Brewer
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Corey Brewer started again and hit 4-of-8 shots, a 3-pointer and 7-of-7 free throws for 16 points, six rebounds, one assist, two steals and a block in 33 minutes of Monday's win over the Kings.
        
        
             Shockingly, Brewer's making some noise for the Thunder, averaging 13.8 points, 3.3 rebounds, 1.0 steals and 1.8 3-pointers in his last four games for his new team. For a guy who's had trouble scoring in his career, Brewer has looked pretty good since joining the Thunder five games ago. And as long as he's going to continue to start and get 30 minutes a night, he might be worth adding in 12-team leagues. Don't drop a good player for him, but if you're sitting on an injured guy like Dwyane Wade, Brewer might be a suitable replacement.

"Carmelo Anthony
                 
                 
                      - F -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Carmelo Anthony hit 7-of-14 shots and five 3-pointers for 21 points, six rebounds, a steal and a block in 32 minutes of Monday's win over the Kings.
        
        
             Melo had just two points on 1-of-8 shooting on Saturday, so his owners had to be thrilled with his bounce-back game tonight. The Thunder are in must-win mode in a tight playoff race, so Melo will have to play well on a nightly basis to help OKC stay in a playoff slot. Start him if you've got him.

"Jabari Parker
                 
                 
                      - F -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jabari Parker never got it going offensively vs. the Grizzlies on Monday, hitting 3-of-6 shots for six points.
        
        
             The rest of his line wasn't much better with three rebounds, two assists and three turnovers. Parker's minutes are still floating around the lower 20s and he was only averaging 12.2 points, 4.6 rebounds, 2.6 assists and 1.4 treys in his previous five games in March. He'll improve, but he's not a must-own player right now.

"Buddy Hield
                 
                 
                      - G -  Kings
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Buddy Hield played just 15 minutes off the bench and hit 1-of-6 shots for three points, one rebound and two blocks on Monday.
        
        
             Hield had played at least 27 minutes in his previous 10 games, but Garrett Temple got hot tonight and Hield's shot wasn't falling. He's been all over the place lately, but as long as he's getting close to 30 minutes a night, he's probably worth using in fantasy. Tonight's low minutes were a fluke, so look for him to get closer to 30 minutes against the Heat on Wednesday night.

             Skal Labissiere is out with a hip injury and we don't know if he'll be ready to go on Wednesday or not. If Skal's out again, chances are Z-Bo will start and get heavy minutes against the Heat, but he's not a must-start player and can be rested on any given night by the Kings.

"Khris Middleton
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Khris Middleton scored 24 points on an efficient 9-of-14 shooting from the field and 4-of-4 from the line in Monday's easy win over Memphis.
        
        
             Slowing down Giannis Antetokounmpo was the focus of Memphis' game plan, so Middleton found himself wide open for several looks. Not only did he shoot the ball well, but Middleton also grabbed six rebounds with four assists, one steal and a pair of triples in 35 minutes. He's flirting with top-30 value on the season and is off to a great start with two games left on the schedule this week.

"Willie Cauley-Stein
                 
                 
                      - C -  Kings
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Willie Cauley-Stein played 29 minutes off the bench and hit 4-of-7 shots for nine points, seven rebounds, a steal and a block in Monday's loss to the Thunder.
        
        
             WCS has been back for two games from his back injury and is averaging 10.5 points, 7.5 rebounds, 1.0 steals and 0.5 blocks in them. It looks like he's healthy and good to go for his three remaining games this week, so hopefully you put him into your lineup. We're guessing he'll start over Kosta Koufos in the next one, but it remains to be seen if it happens or not.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Garrett Temple
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Kings
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Garrett Temple came off the bench to hit 5-of-9 shots and three 3-pointers for 15 points, seven rebounds, one assist, two steals and a block in 29 minutes on Monday.
        
        
             It's impossible to guess if Temple will play well or not on any given night, as he's scored 3, 2, 23, 7 and 15 points in each of his last five games. He's nothing more than a streamer in FDS leagues due to his inconsistency and even then he's a risky play, as he could do nothing or get hot on any given night. He's a gambler's fantasy option, at best, but if you played him tonight, he came through with a solid line.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Giannis Antetokounmpo
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 20 points with six rebounds, four assists, one steal, one block and one triple in Monday's win over the Grizzlies.
        
        
             The Grizzlies were swarming him every time he got the ball, and Giannis turned the ball over six times and was in foul trouble for most of the night. He eventually salvaged his night with a strong fourth quarter, finishing 7-of-14 from the field and 5-of-7 from the line. He will have two more cupcake matchups this week against the Magic on Wednesday and the Hawks on Saturday.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Bogdan Bogdanovic
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Kings
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Bogdan Bogdanovic hit 6-of-11 shots, three 3-pointers and 4-of-5 free throws for 19 points, eight rebounds and three assists in Monday's loss to the Thunder.
        
        
             Bogdanovic has posted a couple duds recently, but bounced back tonight. He plays three more games this week and if you dropped him into your lineup for the week, he's off to a pretty good start. As long as he can stay healthy, his ceiling is high enough for him to be starting any nights he's playing for the Kings. Just expect some inconsistency along the way, as he had hit just 5-of-28 shots in his previous three games before breaking out of his slump tonight.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 12 - 10:34 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Brandon Jennings
                 
                 
                      - G -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Brandon Jennings put on a show in his first game back with the Bucks, scoring 16 points with 12 assists and eight rebounds in 24 minutes in a 121-103 win over the Grizzlies on Monday.
        
        
             Jennings looked like he lost a step in previous stints with the Wizards and Knicks (related to his Achilles injury), but since then he's been dominating overseas and in the G-League. He looked explosive tonight and had the green light for a team that is ranked 28th in 3-pointers per game, hitting 5-of-9 shots, 3-of-6 triples and all three free throws. It's worth noting that Eric Bledsoe (24 minutes) was in foul trouble and the Grizzlies aren't the most formidable team with 18 straight losses, so there are reasons to be skeptical about this line. With that said, he passed the eye test tonight and should at least be on your radar going forward.

"De'Aaron Fox
                 
                 
                      - G -  Kings
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            De'Aaron Fox hit just 4-of-12 shots and a 3-pointer for 11 points, one rebound, 10 assists, a steal and a block with just two turnovers in 34 minutes of Monday's 106-101 loss to the Kings.
        
        
             Fox appears to be healthy again and has played 30 and 34 minutes in his last two games since returning from his back problem. He wasn't great tonight, but the double-double was nice to see and he just missed one with 12 points and nine dimes on Sunday. He should be primed for three more nice games this week and tonight was his third double-double of the season.

The good news is that he does have three more games this week and it's anyone's guess if the Kings will rest WCS in any of them, but the only time Koufos is fully trustworthy is when WCS is resting or injured.

"Steven Adams
                 
                 
                      - C -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Steven Adams suffered a left hip contusion and will not return on Monday vs. the Kings.
        
        
             Adams may have also re-tweaked his left ankle which was the reason he was on the injury report in the first place. The Thunder ruled him out during the fourth quarter of what is surprisingly a close game, so that's a bit concerning. He finished with six points, six rebounds, two assists and two steals. If he misses time, the Thunder will likely play more small ball with Jerami Grant and Patrick Patterson picking up run.

            Hassan Whiteside (hip) hinted that he may not be ready for Wednesday's game vs. the Kings.
        
        
             ""With a strain you want to make sure it's all the way healed,"" Whiteside said. If he sat out on Wednesday that would be his third straight game on the shelf, and this is awful timing for his fantasy owners. In the short term, look for Bam Adebayo and Kelly Olynyk to hold down the fort at center.

"Brandon Jennings

"Enes Kanter
                 
                 
                      - C -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Enes Kanter (back spasms) was a limited participant at Monday's practice and is questionable for Tuesday's game vs. Dallas.
        
        
             Kanter sat out Sunday's game vs. the Raptors and also missed three games back in November due to back spasms, so this is something to watch closely down the stretch. Tanking teams are usually extra cautious with their best players, and Kanter didn't sound certain that he would play. Luke Kornet thrived in the starting lineup on Sunday without Kanter, notching 18 points with four boards, two assists, one block and three triples. Kyle O'Quinn was also productive with eight points, seven rebounds, five assists and three blocks.

"Montrezl Harrell
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Clippers coach Doc Rivers had high praise for Montrezl Harrell.
        
        
             ""You never know a guy until you coach a guy. When we got him, we looked at him as an energy guy, a guy that can play defense,"" Rivers said. ""That’s what he did everywhere he’s been. And then every practice he gets in, he keeps scoring. And scoring. And then we started thinking, ‘Maybe he can score a little bit.’ He’s been better than that. He’s been great."" Harrell has been a scoring machine and is fourth in the NBA in true shooting percentage, behind only Stephen Curry, DeAndre Jordan, and Clint Capela. He's averaging 16.2 points, 4.2 rebounds, 1.2 assists and 1.0 blocks over his last 10 games and the Clippers play four times in each of the next three weeks, making him a solid pickup.

"Kyrie Irving
                 
                 
                      - G -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kyrie Irving is doubtful to play this week in order to rest his knee.
        
        
             ""I think that will probably be the best thing, just instead of kind of hoping it gets better over the two or three days that it usually does,"" Irving said. ""It’s aching a little bit more than I wanted it to now, so I’m taking the necessary time."" He had surgery on his left knee two years ago and Celtics GM Danny Ainge recently said that this is something he will have to manage the rest of his career. Boston is sitting in second place in the East, so they aren't going to take any chances, but it's worth noting that Adrian Wojnarowski reports the Celtics are confident Irving won't need to miss ""significant time."" Terry Rozier is worth a speculative add in most leagues.

             We got the 'good' Covington tonight after seeing the flipside of the coin in an 0-of-10 stinker vs. Miami on Thursday. The asterisk is that he blew up against the Nets' lousy defense tonight (23rd in defensive rating), but fantasy owners will take what they can get. Philly's upcoming matchups are also very promising -- after hosting the Pacers on Tuesday, they get the Knicks, Nets, Hornets, Grizzlies and Magic.

             Chandler looked good, playing 26 minutes while going a very effective 6-of-9 from the field, including 2-of-3 from behind the 3-point line. He was returning from a one-game absence after having an injection in his hip, but didn't appear to play with any type of restrictions. He did catch extra rest for longer periods in the second half with the game mostly out of hand, but owners can expect to have him for all of Denver's games next week.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Gina Mizell on Twitter                            Mar 11 - 8:03 PM

"Nikola Jokic
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nikola Jokic scored 20 points to go along with 11 rebounds, 10 assists, two steals and a blocked shot across 30 minutes Sunday against Sacramento.
        
        
             Jokic recorded his seventh triple-double of the season and the 13th of his career. The team is also 6-1 in his triple-doubles this season, winning each of the past six since dropping a 124-114 decision in his first one back on Jan. 8. He was a very efficient 8-of-10 from the field, including 4-of-4 from behind the 3-point line, and he rolled up a game-high plus-33 rating, too. The Nuggets are back at it on the road Tuesday against the Lakers to tip off a three-game week.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Anthony Davis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Anthony Davis recorded his first career triple-double on Sunday, racking up 25 points, 11 rebounds, 10 blocks, three assists, three steals, one 3-pointer and two turnovers in 40 minutes.
        
        
             Davis tied his season-high in swats (six) before the first half ended, which tied a franchise record (held by Davis) for the most blocks in a half, and his 10 blocks not only set a personal best but also set the new franchise record for most swats in a single game. This was the first points-boards-blocks triple-double since Hassan Whiteside did it back in 2016, and AD is just the second player in NBA history to amass 9,000 points and 9,000 swats prior to turning 25. The other guy? Shaquille O'Neal. He did, however, exit the game during the closing minutes, but maybe he was just gassed after going wild on his birthday.

             Green had been struggling to get his shot to drop over the previous two games, connecting on just 33.3% of his field goal attempts and a mere 20.0% of his shots from beyond the arc, so it was nice to see him get things back on track today. The Dubs do have a back-to-back set against Sacramento and Phoenix next week, so owners should be on the lookout for a potential rest day.

"Kevin Durant

            Kevin Durant scored 39 points on 11-of-32 shooting in Sunday’s 109-103 loss to the Timberwolves, adding 12 boards, five 3-pointers, four assists, three blocks and two turnovers in 39 minutes.
        
        
             Durant was ultra-aggressive in this one putting up his most shot attempts since donning a Dubs' jersey, but Minnesota did an excellent job of loading up on him whenever he touched the ball, consistently forcing him to settle for tightly contested jumpers. "Russell Westbrook
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Russell Westbrook was good for 21 points, 12 rebounds and 10 assists over 36 minutes in Saturday's 104-94 win against the Spurs.
        
        
             It was Westbrook's 19th triple-double of the season, as he continues to be very pleasing to his fantasy owners despite the fact he also picked up five more turnovers. He is now just two triple-doubles shy of 100 for his NBA career. Only three players in NBA history have hit 100 or more triple-doubles - Jason Kidd (107), Earvin 'Magic' Johnson (138) and Oscar Robertson (181).

            Bucks waive F Mirza Teletovic.

Teletovic has had a tough time with a couple blood-related issues, but he's said he is not ready to retire. We hope to see him chucking threes somewhere soon.
        
        
             
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Mar 10 - 8:56 PM

"Shaquille Harrison
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Shaq Harrison looked good in his first NBA start against the Hornets on Saturday, scoring a career-high 14 points with two rebounds, four assists, two steals, one block and one 3-pointer in 21 minutes.
        
        
             He did almost all of his work in the first half with all 14 points coming before the 11-minute mark in the third quarter. Harrison thrived off the ball and he was able to get into the lane at any time he wanted. He also handled the ball more than expected, even next to Elfrid Payton. After playing just 17 minutes next to Elf all season, this strong game bodes very well for Harrison to get additional wing minutes. He's only worth a look in deep leagues with the Suns off for two days. Also, his 10-day deal ends on Tuesday, but you would think the Suns sign him for the year.

"Jaylen Brown
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Coach Brad Stevens said that Jaylen Brown (concussion) has already been ruled out Sunday's game vs. the Pacers and will ""probably"" miss a full week.
        
        
             The good news is that Stevens said ""everything is structurally fine"" with Brown after his frightening fall. However, Jaylen is experiencing concussion symptoms. As is the case with all concussions, there is no way to set a timetable for his return. Each player responds differently. Brown will be able to return only after he has cleared the NBA's concussion protocol. Terry Rozier, Marcus Smart and Marcus Morris will divvy up extra minutes in Brown's absence.

He also chipped in with seven rebounds, two assists and a steal with just one turnover and he was the only New York player in the positive with a plus-4 rating. His team will look for better results Sunday afternoon against Toronto at MSG.

"James Harden
                 
                 
                      - G -  Rockets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            James Harden's 40 points were not enough during a 108-105 loss to the Raptors on Friday, adding two rebounds, four assists and four 3-pointers in 33 minutes.
        
        
             The Rockets' 17-game streak finally comes to an end, and it had a lot to do with their terrible start in the first with Toronto going up 32-16. Harden almost willed the Rockets back with some crazy clutch buckets including a game-tying trey at 2:10 left, but the Raptors had some answers. Clutch has been a trend for the Rockets on the year, entering tonight with a league-leading +21.9 net rating in the clutch. The clutch time is rare with a league-low 82 minutes, and again they played well down the stretch tonight to almost pull off another comeback -- they never led besides a 2-0 start. Harden has MVP in the bag.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Otto Porter
                 
                 
                      - F -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Otto Porter (bruised right hip) participated in shootaround and is a game-time decision for Friday's matchup against New Orleans.
        
        
             Porter initially injured his hip in Tuesday's win over the Heat. He took a shot to the right hip in the fourth quarter, retreated to the locker room, and was unable to return. However, he avoided a serious injury, with the Wiz calling him day-to-day. The fact that he was able to partake in shootaround is a welcomed sign. We should have confirmation of his status for Friday's game at approximately 6:30 PM est, when coach Scott Brooks addresses the media pregame. Kelly Oubre and Markieff Morris will see extended minutes if Porter can't play.

"Davon Reed
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Davon Reed started the third quarter with two points, three rebounds, one assist and one foul in 16 minutes against the Thunder on Thursday.
        
        
             The Suns are running out of wings, but it doesn't sound like Josh Jackson and T.J. Warren will be out for too long. Either way, we have to see Reed show he can produce before signing off on him as an add even in a 20-team league.

"Marcus Morris
                 
                 
                      - F -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marcus Morris finished with 17 points, five rebounds, two assists, and three 3-pointers in a 117-109 victory over Minnesota.
        
        
             Morris hasn't been overly impressive in terms of all-around fantasy production, but he has been scoring consistently for the C's. Morris has now tallied at least 12 points in 18 of his last 21 appearances. He's also averaging nearly two treys per game over this current 21-game stretch.

"Marquese Chriss
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marquese Chriss scored five points with four rebounds and one steal in 24 minutes against the Thunder on Thursday.
        
        
             And so much for that nice two-game stretch. There could be an opportunity for Chriss because of Josh Jackson and T.J. Warren getting hurt, and how Jackson has been playing center. Still, Chriss is not worth the headache in almost any league. Isaac Newton couldn't even understand how this guy loses momentum so fast.

"Alex Len
                 
                 
                      - C -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Alex Len struggled yet again with two points, three rebounds, one block and one steal in 11 minutes against the Thunder on Thursday.
        
        
             It was all good just a week ago. Len had a six-block Friday against this OKC team, but he's been unfathomably bad since. In those three games combined he had just 11 points, eight boards, one block and one steal in only 25 minutes. Maybe Tyson Chandler is dinged up again, but it's almost impossible to hold him in fantasy through these struggles. Len's fantasy value has been falling off cliffs so much that it probably should come with a parachute.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 9 - 12:03 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Kyrie Irving
                 
                 
                      - G -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kyrie Irving (knee) returned to the lineup on Thursday and led the Celtics to a win over the Wolves, finishing with 23 points, seven rebounds, eight assists, three treys and two steals.
        
        
             Irving did not play Monday, and coach Brad Stevens told reporters Kyrie was in danger of missing a full week. However, Irving said he would return for Thursday's contest, and he looked sharp in the victory over Minnesota. Irving was 9-of-15 from the floor, including 3-of-7 from 3-point range, and 2-of-2 from the charity stripe. GM Danny Ainge said he thinks Irving will need to manage his knee pain going forward and hinted as possible rest days, but Kyrie should be ready to roll on Sunday when the C's host the Pacers.

"Elfrid Payton
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Elfrid Payton made 3-of-13 from the field for six points with five rebounds, six assists and two steals in 30 minutes against the Thunder on Thursday.
        
        
             And he's cold as a scorer again. Over his last four, Payton made just 32.7 percent from the field with averages of 11.0 points, 7.5 boards, 7.5 assists, 1.3 steals, 1.0 blocks and no treys. He's still doing plenty besides the poor shooting and he's making free throws, so his fantasy owners shouldn't worry. He may have to score more with the wing injuries, too.

"Troy Daniels
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Troy Daniels made 2-of-15 from the field for six points with six rebounds, one assist, two steals, one block and two 3-pointers in 30 minutes.
        
        
             The Suns slid Devin Booker to small forward a ton today, which opened up the minutes for Daniels. If both Josh Jackson (knee) and T.J. Warren (back) are out for Saturday, Daniels is probably going to have what his former coach David Fizdale called as a ""money green"" light. He's only a speculative add for now, but he's on the radar for DFS or as specialist. He won't have value if Jackson or Warren are a go, though.

"Al Horford
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Al Horford busted out his mini-slump by tallying 20 points, eight rebounds, six assists and a block in Boston's 117-109 victory over the Wolves.
        
        
             Horford was 8-of-14 from the floor, including 1-of-4 from downtown, and 3-of-3 from the free-throw stripe. In the Celtics first six games following the All-Star break, Horford averaged just 8.2 points, 5.8 rebounds and 2.8 assists, while converting only 38.0 percent of his field goal attempts. Thus, Thursday's performance was greeted with a welcomed sigh of relief from Horford owners.

"Andrew Wiggins
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Andrew Wiggins shot just 6-of-21 from the field on his way to 13 points, seven rebounds, four assists, two steals and four turnovers in 38 minutes.
        
        
             According to Basketball-Reference, it's the first time a Timberwolves player has scored fewer than 14 points despite attempting more than 20 shots since February of 2000. However, coming into Thursday, Wiggins had scored 20-plus points in five straight games and had shot 50 percent or better in four of those five contests.

The Suns still may choose to be careful with their rookie, but fantasy owners may still want to hold him in just about all leagues. Davon Reed and Troy Daniels would only be very deep speculative adds.

Center"
"Jaylen Brown
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Fortunately, coach Brad Stevens said that Jaylen Brown (concussion) felt ""pretty good"" after being forced to exit Thursday night's game following a scary fall.
        
        
             Brown went up for a dunk in the third quarter, but his hands slipped off the rim and he fell backward onto his head. It was a frightening fall, with the arena growing grimly silent and doctors rushing to Brown's side. Fortunately, it appears Brown avoided a serious injury to his neck or back. However, he is going to be tested for a concussion. Here is the full quote from coach Stevens: ""[Brown] felt pretty good leaving the arena. He went to get a CT scan. He’s with [Minnesota’s] team doctor, so he’s in good hands."" We should have further updates on Friday morning.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Celtics PR on Twitter                             Mar 8 - 11:15 PM

"Goran Dragic
                 
                 
                      - G -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Goran Dragic made 3-of-13 from the field for seven points with five rebounds, seven assists, three steals and one 3-pointer in 34 minutes during a 108-99 win over the 76ers on Thursday.
        
        
             His 13 attempts from the field matched a team high and he didn't turn the ball over either. Dragic's playing time and usage should still be totally fine with so much depth around him, and his ability to play off the ball should keep him out there in the clutch. He should flirt with top-50 value the rest of the way.

"Dwyane Wade
                 
                 
                      - G -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dwyane Wade scored 16 points with six rebounds, two assists and one 3-pointer in 23 minutes during a 108-99 win over the 76ers on Thursday.
        
        
             It was a huge win for the Heat with a 35-point fourth to help them take sole possession of the No. 7 spot in the playoff hunt. Wade had his fingerprints all over it with a game-sealing, alley-oop dunk with 51 seconds left, which certainly impressed his coach. ""He's filling his cup from the fountain of youth,"" coach Erik Spoelstra said. Wade has been playing his best ball of the year over his last five, averaging 17.2 points, 3.8 boards, 2.8 assists and 0.6steals. He still doesn't have much upside, but feel free to keep firing him up in most leagues.

Considering he's not a significant part of the Thunder's rotation even when fully healthy, he belongs on waivers in all fantasy formats.

"Nemanja Bjelica
                 
                 
                      - F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nemanja Bjelica scored a career-high 30 points on 11-of-16 shooting and added 12 rebounds, two assists and six treys across 40 minutes in Thursday's loss to the Celtics.
        
        
             Bjelica was on fire all evening, almost singlehandedly keeping the Wolves within striking distance of the Celtics. Bjelica was inserted into the starting lineup in place fo Jimmy Butler back in late February and averaged 10.0 points, 7.8 rebounds and 2.0 assists in 36.5 minutes over the first four games after Butler injured his knee. However, this was Belly's breakout performance. He's logged at least 33 minutes in each start, which gives him a relatively high fantasy floor going forward. He will be a hot pickup this week.

                      - C -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Joel Embiid scored 17 points with seven rebounds, three assists and three 3-pointers during a 108-99 loss to the Heat on Thursday.

He's been surprisingly reliable this year. Trust it.

                      - G -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Malik Monk finished with 13 points, three rebounds, five assists, one blocks and two turnovers in 21 minutes on Thursday night.
        
        
             Monk shot 6-of-14 from the field, including just 1-of-6 from downtown. Nonetheless, it qualifies as his best game in quite some time. It is only the second time this season he has dished out more than four dimes. It's also the first time he has scored in double-figures since early November. Coach Steve Clifford said that Monk would see additional minutes with Michael Carter-Williams (left shoulder sprain) sidelined. We'll see if Monk can somehow salvage his rookie season by finishing strong over the final month.

             He probably isn't getting enough credit for one of the best shooting seasons in the NBA. Over his 15 previous games, Saric sports an elite 63.5 TS% on his 21.1 usage rate to help him to a +9.1 net rating. If you're wondering why the 76ers aren't missing Markelle Fultz at all, look no further than Saric after he probably should've won Rookie of the Year last season.

             The Nets continue to use him as a high screener to set up their offense on the vast majority of possessions. Allen is going to struggle against teams like the Warriors, but he's still too solid as a fantasy asset for his owners to worry too much. He's been a sixth-round player over his last 19 games, so keep plugging him in there.

This is good news for the Pelicans after AD rolled his ankle as he stepped on Kosta Koufos' foot and he was unable to return on Wednesday. If he's out, we'll see more Darius Miller, Emeka Okafor, Ian Clark and Cheick Diallo. Jrue Holiday and Nikola Mirotic will get more shots, too.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Adrian Wojnarowski on Twitter                     Mar 8 - 5:34 PM

"Will Barton
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Will Barton was quiet on Wednesday with four points on 2-of-7 shooting, two rebounds, three assists and one steal in 29 minutes off the Nuggets' bench.
        
        
             The seven shot attempts tied Barton's fewest since Jan. 27. Tonight's game was also the first time he'd gone without a 3-pointer in 10 games, and the rebounds were his fewest since Feb. 5, so there are plenty of reasons to write this off as a fluke. Keep him locked and loaded in your active lineups.

             Chandler played the final eight minutes tonight, which is a great sign. Nuggets coach Mike Malone said after Monday's loss to the lowly Mavericks, ""If you’re not going to go out there and give it your all, you’re not going to play ... What each player owes is to go out there and play as hard as you can."" Chandler's shots weren't falling tonight, but as long as he's getting 32+ minutes and has the faith of his coach, he should be a reliable fantasy play.

             Siakam's fantasy value hinges on his ability to chip in defensive stats and we're not reading into tonight's line -- Ibaka will play his usual role on Friday, which limits Siakam to deep-league ownership.              Rubio's shot was off in the first five games after All-Star weekend, but he went 6-of-9 from the field on Monday and came just one shy of his season-high for FG attempts tonight. "Joe Ingles
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Jazz
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Joe Ingles had 11 points, a season-high 10 assists, four rebounds, two 3-pointers and one steal during Utah's impressive 104-84 win on Wednesday.
        
        
             Ingles was terrific in the pick-and-roll game with Utah's bigs tonight, and he became the first Jazz player other than Ricky Rubio to hand out 10+ assists this season. He committed one turnover in 35 minutes tonight and helped Utah improve to 16-2 in their past 18 games, just 1/2 game behind the No. 8 seed Nuggets. He's been one of the more unlikely top-50 values over the past month.

"Bojan Bogdanovic
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Bojan Bogdanovic scored 13 points during Wednesday's home loss, making 4-of-10 FGs and 5-of-6 FTs with four rebounds, two steals and one assist in 33 minutes.
        
        
             The sharp-shooting forward has been on fire lately and he was coming off a season-high-tying 29-point eruption vs. the Bucks on Monday. Bogdanovic went scoreless in a game on Jan. 29, but since he's hit double-digits in every game since. ""I was really, really pissed off [about the scoreless game] ... I just tried to tell myself that I have to be aggressive,"" he said. The message has obviously been received and he's rolling as a mid-round fantasy value since the All-Star break.

             He was listed as questionable yesterday due to knee soreness, but apparently Labissiere is feeling better today. The second-year forward is off to a solid start to his post-break run, averaging 11.6 points, 5.1 boards, 1.7 assists, 1.6 blocks and 0.4 steals in those seven games. He's worth owning in standard leagues right now and hopefully he can keep up the consistency.RotoGrinders.com Daily Slant: With Skal now considered probable, the DFS upside of all three Kings bigs - Randolph and Koufos in addition to Skal - comes down some. Sacramento's rotations are about as unpredictable as any in the league, but it's worth noting that Randolph did rest on Sunday which gives him a nice shot to upend Koufos in terms of minutes, and it's not out of the question that Koufos sits out entirely in order to rest. If that happens, Skal and Randolph would become elite targets.

            Caris LeVert played 25 minutes and hit 4-of-11 shots and a 3-pointer for 10 points, four rebounds, three assists and two steals in Tuesday's loss to the Warriors.

He's had a couple big games since returning from his knee injury and is averaging 13.4 points, 2.8 rebounds, 3.0 assists, 1.0 steals, 0.6 blocks and 1.6 3-pointers on 46 percent shooting over his last five games, and qualifies at several positions in most fantasy leagues. He's still working his way back into form, but looks like a solid pickup for the rest of the season, assuming he can stay healthy.

"Anthony Davis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Anthony Davis returned from a rib contusion to score 41 points in a 121-116 win over the Clippers on Tuesday.
        
        
             He needed X-rays at halftime, but came back and dropped 31 points in the second half and hit a clutch fadeaway jumper to give the Pelicans a two-point cushion with 30 seconds left. He finished 17-of-31 from the field and 3-of-3 from the line to go with 13 rebounds, two assists, three steals, three blocks and four triples in 37 minutes. He has eight games with 40+ points this season and six of those have come after the DeMarcus Cousins injury. He's the best player in fantasy basketball at the moment and it's not close, but owners will want to make sure he's playing on Wednesday night. When asked if he'll play on Wednesday against the Kings, Davis said ""We'll see at 7:00 o'clock."" Stay tuned.

Oubre's foot has been bothering him for a while, but it's likely a wear-and-tear issue because an MRI came back clean. Otto Porter tweaked his troublesome right hip in the win, so Oubre may be asked to step up. In 10 fill-in starts this season, Oubre put up 10.9 points, 5.1 rebounds, 1.1 assists, 0.9 steals and 1.8 triples.

"Russell Westbrook
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Russell Westbrook hit 15-of-27 shots and missed all four of his 3-pointers for 32 points, four rebounds, seven assists, a steal, a block and nine turnovers in Tuesday's 122-112 loss to the Rockets.
        
        
             The Thunder are currently the No. 7 seed, but sit just 1.0 games ahead of the No. 8 Clippers (In action right now) and No. 9 Nuggets, and just 2.0 games ahead of the streaking No. 10 Jazz. The good news for Thunder fans is that they get the Suns on Thursday, the banged-up Spurs on Saturday, then the Kings on Monday and Hawks on Tuesday. They'll need to win those games, as things tighten up with the Clippers, Raptors, Celtics, Heat, Blazers, Spurs and Nuggets to close out March. The Thunder clearly have their work cut out for them if they're going to make the playoffs, as April doesn't look any better: They finish the season at New Orleans, vs. Golden State, at Houston, at Miami and at home against the Grizzlies on the final day of the season. Yikes!

                  In-season Projections"
"Robin Lopez
                 
                 
                      - C -  Bulls
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            According to Shams Charania of Yahoo, the NBA issued a warning to the Bulls on resting healthy players and the team now plans to play Robin Lopez and Justin Holiday more extensively to close the season.
        
        
             Lopez started each of the Bulls first 57 games this season, but has not played a single minute since the All-Star break. That will change after commissioner Adam Silver put his foot down in attempt to prevent teams from blatantly tanking. While Lopez will obviously see in his playing time increase, he likely won't see anywhere close to the 27.7 minutes he was averaging over the first half of the season. Thus, he can be left on waivers in most standard-sized leagues for now. He may be worth a look in deeper leagues.  Rolo's return will cut into the playing time of Cristiano Felicio and Bobby Portis.

"Damian Lillard
                 
                 
                      - G -  Trail Blazers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Damian Lillard hit 12-of-25 shots, 6-of-11 3-pointers and 9-of-12 free throws for 39 points, five rebounds and six assists, racking up 19 of his points in the fourth quarter to hold off the streaking Lakers.
        
        
             Lillard was a freak tonight and several of his threes came from way beyond the arc, or with tough defense in his face. He basically single-handedly got his team the win and the Blazers have now won all six games since the All-Star break. The Blazers have a one-game lead on the Pelicans, Spurs and Timberwolves for the No. 3 seed in the West and are going to try to win every night out in hopes of grabbing home-court advantage in at least the first round of the playoffs. And Lillard is on fire, averaging 32 points, 4.8 rebounds, 6.8 assists, 1.0 steals and 3.8 3-pointers over his last five. He's having an MVP-type season, but won't have much of a shot at winning it given what James Harden and LeBron James have done.

"Isaiah Thomas
                 
                 
                      - G -  Lakers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Isaiah Thomas hit just 5-of-21 shots, 1-of-9 3-pointers and 8-of-9 free throws for 19 points and seven assists in 30 minutes of Monday's loss to the Blazers.
        
        
             His lone missed free throw was massive, as he had a chance to cut the Blazers' lead to one point and get the ball back with seven seconds remaining. However, he missed the free throw, and then had his 3-pointer blocked by Shabazz Napier to seal the win for the Blazers. The good news is that Thomas has been rolling over his last three games, averaging 23 points, 6.7 assists and 2.7 3-pointers. But he doesn't have a steal in his last five games and has struggled with his shot, hitting just 11-of-37 over his last two. But as long as the Lakers keep trying to win games, Thomas should continue to put up solid numbers for the Lakers, although some steals would be nice.

"Rudy Gobert
                 
                 
                      - C -  Jazz
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Rudy Gobert hit 9-of-10 shots and 3-of-6 free throws for 21 points, 17 rebounds, one steal and two blocks in 37 minutes of Monday's 94-80 win over the Magic.
        
        
             The Jazz have been one of the best defensive teams in the league since Gobert got healthy and they are rolling, currently sitting as the No. 10 seed in the West, just 1.5 games behind the Nuggets for the final playoff spot. The Jazz have won three straight and eight of their last 10, and Gobert's a big reason why. The Clippers, Nuggets, Thunder, Timberwolves, Spurs and Pelicans are all within striking distance for the Jazz (3.0 games behind the No. 4 Pelicans), but they'll have to keep winning consistently just to get in. It should be a wild race down the stretch, but we wouldn't bet against a healthy Jazz team right now.

"Kelly Olynyk
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kelly Olynyk matched his career-high with eight assists in Monday's easy win over the Suns, adding 15 points with four rebounds, two steals and two triples in just 20 minutes.
        
        
             This game was over in a hurry, but Olynyk did some serious damage during his brief time on the floor. It's notable that Olynyk played 20 minutes compared to just five garbage-time minutes for Bam Adebayo, but this rotation is almost impossible to predict from night to night. With that said, this was Olynyk's second strong game in a row after scoring 17 points with five rebounds, four assists, one steal and three 3-pointers in 23 minutes on Saturday. With the Heat playing again on Tuesday, it's not a bad idea to pick him back up to see if he can keep it going.

"Justise Winslow
                 
                 
                      - F -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Justise Winslow's strong play continued in Monday's easy 125-103 win over the Suns, racking up 12 points (4-of-9 FGs, 3-of-4 FTs), 12 rebounds, five assists, four steals and one triple in 31 minutes.
        
        
             He did play all 12 minutes of garbage time to help his line and put an exclamation point on his big night with a monster dunk in the final seconds (link below). We're a bit skeptical of adding Winslow because he's a career 40.3% shooter from the field, 31.4% from 3-point range and 66.8% from the line, but he's becoming hard to ignore -- he averaged 12.3 points on 55.9% shooting with 4.5 rebounds, 2.3 assists and 1.8 steals in his previous four games. He will eventually cool off, but give him a look while he's hot.

"George Hill

             Hill was a hot pickup after he exploded for 26 points, five assists and three 3-pointers last Tuesday, but he's still a highly inconsistent player for the Cavs. Hill has now played nine games with the Cavaliers and four of those have been good, where he's scored in double figures and done something to help fantasy owners. In his five single-digit scoring games he's scored a total of just 25 points, or one less than he had last Tuesday. He's worth holding, but expectations should be tempered with Hill playing alongside LeBron James.

Center"
"Michael Beasley
                 
                 
                      - F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Knicks coach Jeff Hornacek is hopeful that Michael Beasley will find the form he had before the All-Star break.
        
        
             ""We want to see Michael play as he did before the break, he was active, played with great confidence,’’ Hornacek said. ""He’s got to put some points on the board for us and defensively help out as much as he can.’’ He's been ice cold since the break, averaging 7.4 points, 4.8 rebounds, 2.0 assists and 1.0 blocks over his last five. Fantasy owners can't be too patient with playoffs starting up, so he's a drop candidate if there's a hot free agent available.
        
        
             
              
             Source: New York Post                                     Mar 5 - 10:24 AM

"Justise Winslow
                 
                 
                      - F -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Justise Winslow said he's ""getting into a better rhythm every game and playing with confidence.""
        
        
             ""Everybody wants to score man, regardless of what they say,"" Winslow said. ""The winning plays thing is true, definitely true. But everybody wants to score. It’s nice when you’re able to do that and other stuff too."" He's currently having the best stretch of his season with 12.3 points on 55.9% shooting with 4.5 rebounds, 2.3 assists and 1.8 steals over his last four games. His 3-point shot is falling right now (6-of-11 in that span), and he's also getting the job done in the paint, hitting 12-of-18 shots. It's hard to rely on Winslow in Miami's crowded rotation, but he's trending up for deep-league owners.

            Jabari Parker was a catalyst for the Bucks' home win on Sunday, coming off the bench with 13 points, seven rebounds, two assists, two steals and three 3-pointers in 21 minutes.
        
        
             Parker played only six minutes in the first half, for some reason, but interim coach Joe Prunty basically couldn't go without him after halftime. This was the first half of a back-to-back set, so perhaps his initial limitations were a medical precaution -- either way, he should be ready to roll for an important game in Indianapolis on Monday.

Philly built a commanding 20-point lead early in the game but wound up falling, 118-110, after giving up a stunning 36 points off turnovers. The good news for Saric's fantasy owners is that his role hasn't been impinged by new arrival Ersan Ilyasova.

I want this to be a long-term thing [with the Sixers],"" he said. ""I love playing here. I love playing with these guys. I love playing for [coach Brett Brown].""             Nikola Mirotic started vs. the Mavs on Sunday and put up 24 points, six 3-pointers, five rebounds, two assists, one block and just one turnover in 31 minutes.
        
        
             Emeka Okafor (right ankle) was out tonight, although Mirotic may have started anyway against a team that starts Dirk Nowitzki at center. He was firing on all cylinders offensively and it's a welcome sight for fantasy owners -- Niko's rebounds (8.1), steals (1.3) and blocks (1.4) are all up with New Orleans, but he'd been averaging 14.0 points on 39.6% shooting. There was considerable buzz around Powell this preseason as a potential starter or sixth-man, but he's been a disappointment in fantasy leagues with just 5.8 points, 1.7 rebounds and 1.4 assists in 15.9 minutes per game.

             Payton got involved in a shoving match with a few Atlanta players towards the end of regulation (link below) and was booted, but his actions likely weren't enough to warrant a suspension. Before being ejected, Payton showed some great hustle on the defensive end and did an excellent job of running the floor and picking his spots in the offense. He’s in a great spot to produce in Phoenix, and shouldn’t have any trouble finishing the year as a top-70 player in 9-cat leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Source: FOX Sports Arizona                                Mar 4 - 5:57 PM

""As we head into this final stretch of the season Trevor will add to the depth of our roster,"" president of basketball operations Kevin Pritchard said. ""Not only is he a solid player and a solid team player, his character fits with our team and what we are trying to accomplish."" The Pacers are already strong up front with Myles Turner, Thaddeus Young and Domantas Sabonis, so Booker is only looking at a handful of minutes off the bench. "Zach Collins
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Trail Blazers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Zach Collins ended up with 12 points over 28 minutes in Saturday's 108-100 win against the Thunder.
        
        
             Collins ended up holding down the fort at power forward with Ed Davis in the middle, and the duo did a great job down the stretch subbing for an ineffective Al-Farouq Aminu and Jusuf Nurkic. Despite the solid 5-of-6 shooting night, including 2-of-2 from behind the arc, Collins isn't going to force Nurkic to the bench anytime soon. He remains useful only in the deepest of fantasy formats at this time.

"Michael Beasley
                 
                 
                      - F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Michael Beasley admitted that he's still looking for an ""organization to believe in me to the point where I can win games.""
        
        
             He might be looking for a while. In all sincerity, Beasley has been incredibly self-reflective about his journey to, from, and back to the NBA, but reputations are very easy to get and incredibly hard to change. ""'Cause my thing is I don't want to just score, I want to make players better,"" Beasley said. ""And I didn't even know that about myself until I went to China the first time."" At the same time, Beasley complained after Friday night's loss about his lack of touches as well as New York's selfish style of play, so perhaps old habits die hard. We shall see.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Frank Ntilikina
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Knicks have started to groom Frank Ntilikina as a shooting guard rather than a point guard.
        
        
             Per Stefan Bondy of the New York Daily News: ""As scouts have noted for months, Ntilikina isn’t quick enough with his dribble to play point guard in the NBA — at least not at this stage of his development. It hinders his playmaking abilities. On defense, Ntilikina’s length allows him to defend shooting guards."" As a result of the transition, Ntilikina is watching tape of DeMar DeRozan, saying that he's ""learning every day"" and has a desire to bring ""everything to the team."" No matter how it's spun, it's clear that the idea the Knicks drafted Ntilikina to be their point guard of the future is no longer team-driven. Expect the rookie to continue playing alongside Emmanuel Mudiay and/or Trey Burke.
        
        
             Related: Trey Burke, Emmanuel Mudiay
              
             Source: New York Daily News                               Mar 3 - 1:14 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"

             Love was previously quoted as hopeful to return sooner, but players are always optimistic about injury timelines regardless of realistic expectations. If Love does indeed wind up missing a full eight weeks, he wouldn't be back until the last week in March, leaving the big man a very limited window of time to be a fantasy asset down the stretch.

"Pau Gasol
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Pau Gasol provided details on his left knee injury, indicating that it was more than a simple bone bruise.
        
        
             Gasol explained how he initially sustained the injury as follows: ""My leg fell straight backward, hyperextending my knee, bone bruise, inflammation, edema, some fluid in the knee, the joint, and you go from there. But no structural damage, which is what you want,"" he said. Although Gasol admitted to being a ""little sore,"" it doesn't sound like he's overly concerned about the knee moving forward. Still, it's nice to have some clarity on the injury rather than a vague diagnosis. As a reminder, Gasol is probable for Saturday's game vs. the Lakers.
        
        
             
              
             Source: San Antonio Express-News                          Mar 3 - 12:46 PM

"Ricky Rubio
                 
                 
                      - G -  Jazz
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Ricky Rubio ended up with 13 points across 31 minutes in Friday's 116-108 win against the Timberwolves.
        
        
             It was a rough go for Rubio, as he hit 3-of-8 from the field, including 0-of-2 from down deep while turning it over three times. He also took a shoulder from Jeff Teague, getting knocked to the floor, and Jimmy Butler was home tweeting his approval. Ouch. Rubio was able to salvage the stat line somewhat with seven assists, five rebounds and a steal. He'll look for better results Sunday in Sacramento.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 3 - 2:52 AM

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Donovan Mitchell
                 
                 
                      - G -  Jazz
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Donovan Mitchell was able to score 26 points across 39 minutes in Friday's victory against the visiting Timberwolves.
        
        
             Mitchell was a solid 10-of-18 from the field, including 2-of-8 from behind the 3-point line, while adding 4-of-5 from the free-throw line. He also added four rebounds, two assists and a steal while turning it over three times. Mitchell has bounced back from a couple of awful performances Feb. 5-7 he is averaging 23.6 PPG with 4.8 RPG, 3.8 APG and 1.4 SPG across the past eight outings. He faces a very favorable matchup Sunday in Sacramento against a Kings team allowing 107.3 PPG.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 3 - 2:49 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Rudy Gobert
                 
                 
                      - C -  Jazz
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Rudy Gobert ended up with a season-high 26 points and a game-high 16 rebounds in 36 minutes Friday against the Timberwolves.
        
        
             Gobert was a very efficient 7-of-9 from the field while going 12-of-14 from the free-throw line, adding an assist, a steal and four blocked shots. He took advantage of the fact Karl-Anthony Towns was hit with his second technical foul in the second quarter, clearing the way for a big game for the Stifle Tower. In fact, it was his 18th double-double of the season, and he already had it before halftime. He and his Utah teammates will be back at it Saturday in Sacramento in another favorable matchup.

                  In-season Projections"
"Nemanja Bjelica
                 
                 
                      - F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nemanja Bjelica finished with 12 points across 45 minutes in Friday's loss at Utah.
        
        
             Bjelica hit 3-of-8 from the floor, including 2-of-4 from behind the 3-point line, while adding 4-of-4 from the free-throw line. He was relied upon heavily in the frontcourt with Karl-Anthony Towns getting the boot in the second quarter after a second technical. He'll continue to log heavy minutes with Jimmy Butler (knee) on the mend.

"Gorgui Dieng
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Gorgui Dieng finished with six points across 19 minutes in Friday's loss at Utah.
        
        
             Dieng was seeing another game with big minutes with Nemanja Bjelica logging plenty of run at small forward. Dieng was used plenty at the four, and he was needed in the middle with Karl-Anthony Towns suffering an ejection early in the game. Despite the uptick in playing time lately Dieng is still only worth using in deeper fantasy leagues at this juncture.
