                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Taj Gibson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Taj Gibson (left hip contusion) finished with 12 points in his return to the lineup Friday in Utah.
        
        
             Gibson hit a very efficient 6-of-8 from the field with four rebounds, three assists and a steal across 39 minutes. Coach Tom Thibodeau said before the game that Gibson was feeling much better, and the fact he didn't play with any kind of minutes cap or restrictions means Gibson is officially 100 percent. Unfortunately for his fantasy owners, you'll now have to wait until Thursday until he and his team play again.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 3 - 2:36 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Jeff Teague
                 
                 
                      - G -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jeff Teague was ejected in Friday's game at Utah after putting a shoulder into Ricky Rubio and knocking the former Wolves guard to the floor.
        
        
             Teague's play drew praise from the injured Jimmy Butler, who tweeted that he liked what he saw from the guard. Before his ejection he finished with 25 points on 9-of-15 shooting, including 2-of-4 from behind the 3-point line, and he added four rebounds, two assists and two steals. If you want to split hairs, he was just 5-of-8 from the free-throw line to disappoint fantasy owners in roto leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 3 - 2:33 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Andrew Wiggins
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Andrew Wiggins posted 27 points in Friday's 116-108 road loss at Utah across 35 minutes.
        
        
             Wiggins was forced to pick up the slack with Karl-Anthony Towns and Jeff Teague ejected during the testy game, and Jimmy Butler still on the shelf due to injury. He hit 10-of-19 from the field, including a red-hot 4-of-4 from behind the 3-point line, and he finished with three rebounds, an assist and a steal. The only thing fantasy owners could complain about in this one is the 3-of-8 night from the free-throw line and four turnovers.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Lou Williams
                 
                 
                      - G -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Lou Williams posted 21 points across 29 minutes off the bench in Friday's 128-105 win against the visiting Knicks.
        
        
             Williams hit 6-of-16 from the field, but he was 0-of-6 from downtown. He made up for it from the free-throw line, going 9-of-10 while adding eight assists, three rebounds and no turnovers while turning in a plus-6 rating. He has hit for 20 or more points in 14 of the past 17 games. Williams continues to roll up top-30 value in standard 9-category fantasy leagues.

"Sam Dekker
                 
                 
                      - F -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Sam Dekker was good for 10 points and six rebounds over 16 minutes off the bench in Friday's win against New York.
        
        
             Dekker hit 5-of-7 from the field, but he didn't chip in across any other stat categories. His minutes were highest since he logged 19 minutes Jan. 13 against Sacramento. Despite the 10-point performance he is still best left to the waiver wire all but the deepest of fantasy formats.

"Montrezl Harrell
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Montrezl Harrell ended up with 19 points across just 16 minutes in Friday's 128-105 win against the Knicks.
        
        
             Harrell hit 8-of-9 from the field while adding 3-of-4 from the free-throw line. He added four rebounds, two assists, a steal and a blocked shot while posting a plus-10 rating, best among all players off the bench. He tied a season best with his fifth consecutive double-digit points game. Harrell is averaging 16.6 PPG and 4.2 RPG over the past five outings. He is putting up top-100 value in roto leagues.

"C.J. Williams
                 
                 
                      - G -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            C.J. Williams went for just six points across 26 minutes in Friday's 128-105 win against the visiting Knicks.
        
        
             Williams hit just 3-of-10 from the field, including 0-of-3 from behind the arc, but he salvaged the stat line somewhat with five assists, four steals and two rebounds. He has struggled in his two games since returning from a rehab assignment in the G-League after a long-term ankle injury. He is hitting just 33.3 percent (6-of-18) from the floor while averaging 6.0 PPG, 3.0 APG and 2.0 SPG in two outings. Even as a member of the starting five he has very little fantasy appeal outside of the deepest formats.

"Austin Rivers
                 
                 
                      - G -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Austin Rivers managed 19 points on 7-of-13 shooting across 28 minutes in Friday's 128-105 win against the Knicks.
        
        
             It was the most points for Rivers since returning from an 18-game absence due to an ankle injury. Rivers hit 5-of-7 from downtown while adding five rebounds, two assists and a steal. The five triples were his most since Dec. 22 when he dropped in six treys in Houston, and they were his most at home since he hit six threes in a game against Detroit on Oct. 28.

"DeAndre Jordan
                 
                 
                      - C -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            DeAndre Jordan went for 19 points and 20 rebounds across 28 minutes in Friday's 128-105 win against the Knicks.
        
        
             Jordan was a very efficient 9-of-11 from the field while adding three assists, two blocked shots and a steal. He did a great job on the defensive end, holding down Enes Kanter in the blowout win. Jordan has grabbed 13 or more boards in 12 or the past 13 outings. He'll look to keep it rolling against the Nets on Sunday, a team allowing 109.7 points per game, third-worst in the Eastern Conference and sixth-worst in the NBA.

"Trey Burke
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Trey Burke was good for 12 points across 19 minutes off the bench in Friday's 128-105 road loss against the Clippers.
        
        
             Burke hit 5-of-11 from the field, including 2-of-3 from behind the 3-point line, while chipping in with two assists, a rebound and just two turnovers. The former standout at the University of Michigan is averaging 20.5 points and 5.3 assists over the past four outings with a total of seven 3-pointers. He isn't starting, but he is getting plenty of minutes to make him useful from a fantasy perspective.

"Troy Williams
                 
                 
                      - F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Troy Williams picked up 11 points in just 17 minutes off the bench in Friday's 128-105 loss against the Clippers.
        
        
             Williams connected on 4-of-5 from the field, including a perfect 3-of-3 from behind the arc, while adding two assists, a steal and a rebound. He was seeing his most minutes in four games since coming over from the Rockets. It was a combination of Williams getting a hot hand and Michael Beasley leaving to have his left ankle re-taped.

"Courtney Lee
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Courtney Lee ended up with 15 points across 26 minutes in Friday's road loss against the Clippers.
        
        
             Lee ended up hitting 5-of-8 from the field, including 3-of-4 from behind the 3-point line, while adding 2-of-3 from the charity stripe. The points were about all he contributed to the bottom line, as he has just one assist and two turnovers with no other offensive stats. Lee hasn't been doing a terrible job in the scoring department, but he isn't offering much else in other categories. If there is a hot add off the waiver wire, Lee isn't a bad drop option.

"Emmanuel Mudiay
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Emmanuel Mudiay ended up with nine points on 2-of-10 shooting in Friday's road loss against the Clippers.
        
        
             Mudiay was able to salvage the stat line with seven assists, three rebounds and just two turnovers across 26 minutes. He is averaging 5.6 assists per game in seven outings since coming over from the Nuggets, but his shooting has been rather erratic and his scoring totals have yo-yoed. He isn't terribly efficient, but he racks up some counting stats for those in points leagues and DFS play.

"Enes Kanter
                 
                 
                      - C -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Enes Kanter was good for 18 points with 14 rebounds across 30 minutes in Friday's road loss against the Clippers.
        
        
             Kanter hit 9-of-16 from the field while also chipping in with two steals, two blocked shots and just one turnover. It was Kanter's first two-block game since Jan. 30, a span of 11 outings, and it was his first game with at least two steals since Jan. 5 in Miami. He'll look to keep it going on Sunday in Sacramento against the soft middle of the Kings.

"Tim Hardaway Jr.
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Tim Hardaway Jr. finished with 17 points in Friday's 128-105 road loss against the Clippers.
        
        
             Hardaway hit 7-of-13 from the field, but he was a dismal 0-of-5 from behind the 3-point line. He also chipped in with a 3-of-3 night from the free-throw line while adding four assist and three rebounds over 34 minutes. After some offensive struggles in late January into most of February, he has picked up the pace lately. Over the past five outings he is averaging 21.6 points, 3.4 assists, 2.8 rebounds and 2.4 3-pointers per game.

"Michael Beasley
                 
                 
                      - F -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Michael Beasley (ankle) posted seven points with two rebounds, an assist and a blocked shot over 20 minutes Friday against the Clippers.
        
        
             Beasley left with a left ankle injury and had it re-taped on the bench and was able to return. He was only able to play 20 minutes, hitting 3-of-7 from the field while going 1-of-2 from the free-throw stripe. Beasley should be able to go for Sunday's game in Sacramento, and he'll have about 48 hours to get better. Troy Williams and Lance Thomas would benefit if Beasley would be unable to go.

"Devin Booker
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Devin Booker put up 39 points (16-of-28 FGs) with eight assists, six rebounds, one block and six triples in a 124-116 loss to the Thunder on Friday.
        
        
             If not for some heroics by Russell Westbrook in the fourth quarter, Booker would be celebrating a win to go with his big night -- he became the third youngest player to reach 4,000 career points (LeBron James and Kevin Durant). He's been on fire with four straight games of 30+ points, the first Suns player to do that since Amar'e Stoudemire in 2004.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Suns Stats on Twitter                             Mar 3 - 12:31 AM

"Josh Jackson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Josh Jackson returned to the bench on Friday vs. the Thunder, but still put a great line with 19 points, five rebounds, four assists, two steals and one triple in 26 minutes.
        
        
             He had five fouls, so he was likely going to play a lot more. Jackson had one of the highlights of the night when he spun around Paul George for a driving layup and is starting to develop some nice chemistry with Devin Booker. ""We knew what would happen,"" Jackson said. ""It was only a matter of time."" He was 8-of-15 from the field and 2-of-5 from the line, but the sky's the limit for him in fantasy when he starts hitting his free throws.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Evan Sidery on Twitter                            Mar 3 - 12:27 AM

"T.J. Warren
                 
                 
                      - F -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            T.J. Warren (tailbone) returned from a one-game absence on Friday vs. the Thunder, scoring 19 points with four rebounds, one assist, one block and two turnovers.
        
        
             He must've been feeling good, as he logged a team-high 42 minutes. He finished 8-of-19 from the field and was second only to Devin Booker in shot attempts, so it was business as usual for Warren. The Suns are using him next to Josh Jackson a ton, so both of their outlooks are strong going forward.

"Alex Len
                 
                 
                      - C -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Alex Len matched his career-high with six blocks in Friday's 124-116 loss to the Thunder, adding seven points, eight rebounds and one assist in 22 minutes.
        
        
             He had a few blocks in the opening minutes of the game, finishing 3-of-5 from the field and 1-of-2 from the line. Tyson Chandler (neck) could be back on Sunday, but Len has been playing too well to leave on the wire and may even keep his starting job. If you ignore his foul-plagued dud vs. the Pelicans, Len is averaging 10.4 points, 10.4 rebounds, 1.4 assists and 2.8 blocks over his last five.

"Paul George
                 
                 
                      - F -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Paul George had a nice all-around line on Friday vs. the Suns with 20 points, five rebounds, five assists, two steals, two blocks and three triples.
        
        
             He logged 37 minutes in the win, hitting 6-of-16 shots and 5-of-6 free throws with three turnovers. The counting stats have been great, but George's shot has let him down in recent weeks -- since the All-Star break he has hit 31-of-85 shots (36.4%). George gets a matchup with the Blazers on Saturday night as the Thunder look for their fourth straight win.

"Russell Westbrook
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Russell Westbrook led the Thunder to a 124-116 comeback win over the Suns in style, scoring 43 points with 14 rebounds, eight assists, one steal, one block and two triples.
        
        
             Westy finished 16-of-25 from the field and 9-of-11 from the line with five turnovers, and it was his go-ahead 3-pointer with 56 seconds left that gave OKC a 119-116 edge. He also came up with two huge offensive rebounds in the final minute. This was his third game of the season with 40+ points, and after stumbling out of the All-Star break, he's hot again with a combined 73 points in his last two games.

"Harrison Barnes
                 
                 
                      - F -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Harrison Barnes scored 26 points for the second straight game on Friday vs. the Bulls, hitting 9-of-19 shots and 7-of-7 free throws.
        
        
             Barnes played a team-high 34 minutes with seven rebounds, two assists and one triple. Since his 9-point dud vs. Utah he's been on fire, averaging 24.3 points, 5.0 rebounds, 2.7 assists, 1.0 steals and 1.7 triples over his last three games. He's the safest fantasy option in Dallas going forward.

"Karl-Anthony Towns
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Karl-Anthony Towns was ejected in the second quarter against the Jazz on Friday.
        
        
             The first technical was justified with a play against Jae Crowder, but the second one was a joke after KAT looked at a ref after what he likely thought was a non-call against Rudy Gobert. Chances are this tech will be rescinded, but Towns isn't in jeopardy of missing games because he's only up to five on the year despite being second in the NBA for total minutes. He'll get a week off with the Wolves being off until Thursday of next week. KAT finished with 13 points, four rebounds, one steal and one 3-pointer in 20 minutes.

"Stephen Curry
                 
                 
                      - G -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stephen Curry (ankle) said he doesn't expect to miss time.
        
        
             Curry also said he plans to play at Augusta National Park on Saturday, but Curry sure does love his golf and this isn't a surprise.  In case you missed it, he also broke a glass table in his hotel with his seven iron as he was practicing his swing. The Warriors are off until Tuesday, so his fantasy owners should be planning on him being ready.
        
        
             
              
             Source: Connor Letourneau on Twitter                      Mar 2 - 11:34 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Nerlens Noel
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nerlens Noel played 15 minutes vs. the Bulls on Friday, missing all three of his shots and finishing with zero points, six rebounds, one assist, two steals and two blocks.
        
        
             Noel is trying to build his value back up for free agency this summer and coach Rick Carlisle is keeping his word about giving him a chance. ""It's the worst-kept secret in the world that he's playing for a contract - let's be honest,"" Carlisle said. ""And we want him to do well. Hey, we traded for him with the hope that he could be here long term. And sometimes things don't go exactly as planned."" He played 16 minutes in his last game and Carlisle said he ""played with a lot of activity,"" but Dwight Powell is still the better pickup in Dallas for the time being. We'll be watching Noel's minutes closely.
        
        
             
              
             Source: SportsDay                                         Mar 2 - 11:32 PM

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"DeMar DeRozan
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            DeMar DeRozan scored 23 points with four rebounds, four assists, three steals and no turnover in 34 minutes during a 102-95 win over the Wizards on Friday.
        
        
             The Raptors continue to rack up the wins with 10 in their last 11 as they continue to hold a 1.0-game lead over the Celtics for the top spot. Home court advantage will be huge for the Raptors with their NBA-best 25-5 record in The North, so that should mean guys like DeRozan and Kyle Lowry are out there until they're locked in.

             He still has a soft minutes cap on him and he's yet to have a big game since his groin injury. Hollis-Jefferson is starting to play more small forward and his minutes could start to trend up in the near future. He's still a hold in 12-team leagues.

            Spencer Dinwiddie scored eight points with six rebounds, five assists, two steals and one turnover in 36 minutes against the Kings on Thursday.
        
        
             Even with the quiet game, he still had the ball in his hands to get two made free throws with six seconds left to get a two-point lead.              Just yesterday, coach Tom Thibodeau said the Wolves wouldn't buy out Muhammad's contract, saying, ""Nope, we live the team we have.""              Harrell played 29 minutes and continues to be a handful for opposing benches. Center"
"Russell Westbrook
                 
                 
                      - G -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Russell Westbrook scored a game-high 30 points during a 111-110 overtime win over the Mavs on Wednesday, adding 11 rebounds, seven assists, three steals, one block and nine turnovers in 42 minutes.
        
        
             The Thunder lucked out to get this win and they didn't get the Bestbrook version of their reigning MVP. Westbrook has also been a mess since the break and is wasting a ton of possessions, averaging a whopping 7.3 turnovers per game with his woeful 33.3 percent from the field on 16.5 attempts per game. OKC still went 3-1 in those game and they sit in the No. 7 spot in the air-tight Western Conference standings.
        
        
             
              
             Mar 1 - 12:02 AM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Steven Adams
                 
                 
                      - C -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Steven Adams scored nine points with 12 rebounds, two boards and one block in 38 minutes against the Mavs on Wednesday.
        
        
             He did suffer what looked to be a mild right elbow injury, but Adams looks to be OK. Adams was up to his usual tricks on the offensive glass with nine of them on that end to add to his lead in that category this season. He makes a bigger impact in reality, but his fantasy owners have to be pleased with his fifth-round value this season for nine-category leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:58 PM

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Kemba Walker
                 
                 
                      - G -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Hornets' five-game win streak ended in Boston on Wednesday, despite Kemba Walker's team-high 23 points on 9-of-13 shooting, five assists and four 3-pointers.
        
        
             The loss is dispiriting for the Hornets' playoff hopes, but Walker's owners won't complain. He's reeled off seven straight games with at least 50% shooting from downtown, and could have had a much bigger line if Boston didn't run away in the third quarter. Kemba wound up playing just 25 minutes, so at least he'll be rested to face the Sixers on Friday.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:58 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Treveon Graham
                 
                 
                      - G -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Treveon Graham played 30 minutes as a starter on Wednesday, but finished with just two points on 1-of-5 shooting, one rebound and one steal.
        
        
             Michael Kidd-Gilchrist (left hamstring) was out tonight, and coach Steve Clifford presumably didn't want to meddle with the chemistry of his second unit by starting Jeremy Lamb (10 points in 25 minutes). Graham could be a cheap deep-league source of steals and 3-pointers until MKG returns, but most owners should leave him untouched.
        
        
             Related: Michael Kidd-Gilchrist, Jeremy Lamb

"Jerami Grant
                 
                 
                      - F -  Thunder
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jerami Grant scored 12 points with five rebounds and one 3-pointer in 15 minutes against the Mavs on Wednesday.
        
        
             He did look to have a mild right ankle tweak, but he stayed in the game. Grant could lose a couple minutes to Corey Brewer, so his owners in deep leagues will want to see how that plays out.

"Willy Hernangomez
                 
                 
                      - C -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Willy Hernangomez grabbed six rebounds in nine minutes off the Hornets' bench on Wednesday.
        
        
             Even with Cody Zeller (knee) unavailable after getting hurt on Tuesday, Hernangomez couldn't gain any traction in the rotation. He shot 0-of-4 from the field tonight and has yet to score in a Hornets jersey. Enough said.
        
        
             Related: Cody Zeller
              
             Feb 28 - 11:53 PM

                  In-season Projections"
"Dwight Howard
                 
                 
                      - C -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dwight Howard (ribs) played through his injury on Wednesday, finishing with 21 points on 10-of-15 shooting, three rebounds, one steal and one block in 26 minutes.
        
        
             The 14th-year veteran deserves plenty of credit for keeping Charlotte in the playoff hunt. He's yet to miss a game, ranks fourth in double-doubles (38), and has made life difficult for opposing centers. The rebounds were the lowest for Howard in a game he didn't leave early this season, so we'll keep an eye out for any indication that it was injury-related. He should be fine for a showdown vs. Joel Embiid and the Sixers on Friday.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:53 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Dwight Powell
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dwight Powell matched his career-high 21 points against the Thunder during a 111-110 overtime loss on Wednesday, adding eight rebounds, three assists and three steals in 37 minutes.
        
        
             He made 10-of-13 from the field and hit a shot at the rim at the buzzer to send this game to overtime. One small bit of bad news is Powell made just 1-of-6 from the line in this home loss. That aside, he continues to see big minutes and played 33 on Monday, and it doesn't look like Nerlens Noel will be affecting his playing time. Powell should be owned in standard leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:52 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"James Ennis
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            James Ennis started over Stanley Johnson on Wednesday, but he shot just 2-of-6 from the field for four points, one rebound and four personal fouls in 15 minutes.
        
        
             Ennis didn't fare well but the Pistons still rolled to a 110-87 victory tonight. Stan Van Gundy mentioned poor transition defense as a specific problem prior to the game, yet they limited the Bucks to just six fastbreak points tonight. That alone should earn Ennis another start on Friday, but he's only worth considering in very deep leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Feb 28 - 11:47 PM

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Harrison Barnes
                 
                 
                      - F -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Harrison Barnes scored 26 points against the Thunder on Wednesday, adding five rebounds, five assists, two steals and three 3-pointers in 39 minutes.
        
        
             The scoring is nice, but the dimes were unusual. Those five dimes are the most he's had since November and they come close to the eight total dimes he had in his previous February games. Barnes also hit 2.0 treys per game this month, which is his best monthly average since joining the Mavs.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:47 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Dwight Buycks
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dwight Buycks played a season-high-tying 24 minutes off the bench vs. Milwaukee, posting 12 points, four assists, four steals and one rebound.
        
        
             Buycks shot 6-of-6 from the line but was 3-of-12 from the field. He also got a lot of minutes in garbage time, and owners should view him skeptically -- among other obstacles to value, the Pistons could welcome back Reggie Jackson (ankle) in early March.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:46 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Stanley Johnson
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stanley Johnson shifted to the Pistons' bench on Wednesday, where he had 19 points, six rebounds, four assists and one steal, making 6-of-11 FGs and 6-of-6 FTs in 30 minutes.
        
        
             James Ennis took over in the starting lineup but flopped with just four points and four fouls in 15 minutes. Despite tonight's solid line, Johnson's offense is very much a work in progress. That's likely part of the reason for his benching, and it makes tonight's efficient line even more surprising. We'll need to see him reproduce this a few times before buying.
        
        
             Related: James Ennis
              
             Feb 28 - 11:46 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Nerlens Noel
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nerlens Noel scored four points with three rebounds, one assist, one steal, one block and three turnovers in 16 minutes against the Thunder on Wednesday.
        
        
             His first stint was really bad with three turnovers in five minutes, but he looked OK after that. It looks like the Mavs will be giving Noel some minutes going forward, but he'll have a tough time unseating Dwight Powell and Dirk Nowitzki to get to over 20 minutes. He's a mysterious flier in deeper leagues for now.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:41 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Blake Griffin
                 
                 
                      - F -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Blake Griffin had eight points on 3-of-10 shooting, nine rebounds, seven assists and three turnovers in 25 minutes during Wednesday's lopsided home win.
        
        
             The learning curve in Detroit has been steeper than Griffin's fantasy owners bargained for, at least through 11 games. He came in averaging 19.3 points on 40.1% shooting, 6.6 rebounds and 0.5 steals, which are all below than his numbers with the Clippers. ""I haven't been able to get us into a flow where we're getting good ball movement and getting Blake opportunities,"" said Stan Van Gundy. ""He's a focal-point guy and has to be."" It's good to know that SVG wants to better exploit Blake's skills, and he did get the ball in spots to create plays tonight, but the clock is ticking with only 21 regular-season games remaining.
        
        
             
              
             Source: MLive.com                                         Feb 28 - 11:39 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Eric Moreland
                 
                 
                      - C -  Pistons
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Eric Moreland recorded his first career double-double on Wednesday with 10 points, 12 rebounds and six assists in 21 minutes off the Pistons bench.
        
        
             Two words are sufficient to explain Moreland's outburst tonight -- garbage time. The scoring, rebounds and assists were all career-highs, and five of Moreland's dimes came with the game already decided in the fourth quarter. This is worth remembering, but shouldn't prompt anyone to pick him up.

"Kevin Durant
                 
                 
                      - F -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kevin Durant scored 32 points during a 109-101 win over the Wizards on Wednesday, adding six rebounds, four assists and three 3-pointers in 37 minutes.
        
        
             Score one for the hometown narrative street crew. Durant got off to a hot start today with 16 points in the first to move him past Mitch Richmond for 40th on the all-time scoring list. His February has been his best full month as a Warrior for points per game with 27.6 and he did so on an absurd 74.9 TS%. He's arguably the best scorer ever.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Khris Middleton
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Bucks dropped their third consecutive game on Wednesday, with Khris Middleton contributing 17 points, two steals, one rebound and one assist in 30 minutes.
        
        
             Middleton's overall line wasn't great and he shot 3-of-10 from the field, but he helped category-based owners with a 10-of-10 mark at the FT line. He's moved into the top-15 for weighted FT% this season, which is an underrated part of his fantasy appeal.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Matthew Dellavedova
                 
                 
                      - G -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Matthew Dellavedova (sprained right ankle) wasn't on the Bucks' active roster on Wednesday.
        
        
             The veteran guard went through part of Monday's practice and it sounds like he was pretty active, doing cuts and getting ""good lift"" on his jumpers. Even when he's 100 percent, though, he'll be hard-pressed to help fantasy owners.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 11:33 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"John Henson
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            John Henson played 25 minutes on Wednesday, finishing with six points, four rebounds, two assists and two blocks.
        
        
             Thon Maker logged 10 minutes off the bench, while Tyler Zeller played 11 minutes, and coach Joe Prunty confirmed that he's sticking with a three-center rotation. ""A lot of it is the flow of the game,"" Prunty said. ""The bottom line that we've always said is 'be ready when your number is called.'"" Henson is easily the best of the bunch for fantasy purposes, but top-100 value might be out of reach while Maker and Zeller are both in the mix.
        
        
             Related: Tyler Zeller, Thon Maker
              
             Source: ESPN.com                                          Feb 28 - 11:32 PM

"Draymond Green
                 
                 
                      - F -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Draymond Green scored 11 points with six rebounds, 11 assists, two steals, two blocks and two turnovers in 37 minutes against the Wizards on Wednesday.
        
        
             He's been vintage Dray since the break, averaging 11.3 points, 5.5 boards, 7.8 assists, 1.5 steals, 1.5 blocks and 0.5 treys on 60.0 percent from the field in 34.9 minutes per game. Green is protecting the rim more these days and his minutes are slightly up. Green should be good to go as long as he avoids technical fouls, but keep an eye on his status for a back-to-back set on Mar. 8-9.

"Andre Iguodala
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Andre Iguodala scored 14 points with seven rebounds, two assists, three blocks, one steal and no turnovers in 30 minutes against the Wizards on Wednesday.
        
        
             The Hampton Five lineup was big in this game and coach Steve Kerr seems to be going to it more these days. That could be due to the playoffs approaching or because he's not as confident in his centers right now. Iguodala wasn't doing much from a fantasy perspective with the added minutes, so he's more of a streamer in 12-team leagues.

             Coach Steve Kerr said he was open to playing Jordan Bell at power forward or center, but clearly Bell still has some work to do to earn consistent minutes. Just keep an eye on him in deeper leagues.

                  In-season Projections"
"Stephen Curry
                 
                 
                      - G -  Warriors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Stephen Curry scored 25 points with five rebounds, three assists, two steals and four 3-pointers against the Wizards on Wednesday.
        
        
             He did look to have a minor tweak to his leg in the second half, but he stayed in the game and looked fine. Curry uncharacteristically had 11 makes from the line in this win for his most since Jan. 6, and more than tripling his previous February average of just 3.2 makes per game. He continues to flirt with 50/40/90 and is in the second tier for MVP.

"Otto Porter
                 
                 
                      - F -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Otto Porter (right elbow) matched his season-high 29 points during a 109-101 loss to the Warriors on Wednesday, adding 10 rebounds, two assists, two steals and four 3-pointers in just 32 minutes.
        
        
             He had X-rays on his sore right elbow today and wasn't a lock to play, but obviously he was more than fine. Porter continues to be the guy that has seen a huge usage boost to help offset the loss of John Wall and it hasn't really hurt his efficiency either. Everything is working out just fine for the Wizards on their max deal so far and his fantasy owners are getting an early-round player for the second straight season.

"Jabari Parker
                 
                 
                      - F -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jabari Parker had seven points, four rebounds and four turnovers in 18 minutes vs. Detroit on Wednesday.
        
        
             The headline here is that Parker was cleared to play in both games of a back-to-back set for the first time all season. It looks like his minute-limit remains in place (he maxed out at 27 minutes on Tuesday), but at least owners won't have to be quite as concerned about DNPs down the stretch. Milwaukee has two back-to-back sets left on the schedule -- Mar. 4-5 and Mar. 29-30.

"Pau Gasol
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Spurs
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            An MRI revealed no structural damage in Pau Gasol's bruised left knee.
        
        
             Gasol is dealing with a bone bruise, so although the MRI was negative, it's still unclear when he'll be cleared to return. Joffrey Lauvergne and Davis Bertans could be very busy vs. the Lakers on Saturday, especially if LaMarcus Aldridge (ankle) can't suit up. We should have multiple updates in the next few days.

"Bradley Beal
                 
                 
                      - G -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Bradley Beal made 3-of-15 from the field for eight points with four rebounds, five assists, one steal and two 3-pointers against the Warriors on Wednesday.
        
        
             It was a game to forget for the All-Star with his first make from the field not coming until 5:19 left in the third quarter. Beal's scoring hasn't really gone up since John Wall went down, but the big difference has been his seven dimes per game since Jan. 30. He'll be a difference maker in fantasy the rest of the way.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Norman Powell
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Norman Powell started the second half on Wednesday in place of OG Anunoby (ankle), but finished without a single statistic to his credit in 11 minutes.
        
        
             Anunoby was diagnosed with a sprain -- X-rays were negative and we'll consider him questionable for Friday's game in D.C. Powell could get a boost if Anunoby can't suit up, but tonight's line should scare away all but the most optimistic owners. Pascal Siakam, C.J. Miles, Fred VanVleet and Jakob Poeltl are all currently more attractive options in Toronto's thriving bench unit.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 10:52 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Pascal Siakam
                 
                 
                      - F -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Pascal Siakam sank 7-of-9 shots for 14 points on Wednesday, adding six rebounds, four assists, two steals and one block.
        
        
             Siakam didn't turn the ball over in 25 minutes of action, and he's come out of nowhere to average 14.8 points on 74.3% shooting over the past four games. ""[Siakam] has done a heck of a job of working on his ball handling, decision making, understanding,"" said Dwane Casey. ""I’m really impressed with Pascal. His energy is an NBA skill ... he sets the tone for that second unit and that speed that they play with."" He won't keep up this efficiency, but is doing enough to warrant a look in deeper leagues.
        
        
             
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Feb 28 - 10:52 PM

"Giannis Antetokounmpo
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Bucks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Giannis Antetokounmpo (eye) said he'll be fine after an eye injury on Wednesday.
        
        
             He said he had blurred vision that continued after the game when he looked down, but he said he hopes he can sleep it off. Giannis' right eye appears to be the worst of the two, but for now it sounds like he's OK. He finished with just 11 points, three rebounds and two assists against the Pistons.

Center"
"Kelly Oubre
                 
                 
                      - F -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Kelly Oubre made 4-of-16 from the field and 7-of-9 from the line for 17 points with four rebounds, three assists, one block and two 3-pointers in 34 minutes against the Warriors on Wednesday.
        
        
             He continues to produce in the counting stats, but Oubre has had a handful of duds for FG%. That pretty much sums up his February, averaging 11.1 points, 4.0 boards, 1.3 assists, 1.1 steals and 1.4 treys in his previous games this month. He should still be worth owning in most leagues, especially if you're punting FG%.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 10:45 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Serge Ibaka
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Serge Ibaka finished Wednesday's game with nine points on 4-of-8 shooting, two rebounds, one steal, one block and one 3-pointer in 23 minutes.
        
        
             Ibaka was red-hot over his previous five games, averaging 16.2 points (60.4% FGs, 100.0% FTs), 1.4 triples, 8.0 rebounds and 1.6 blocks. That pace was unsustainable, but owners still have to be encouraged. ""[Ibaka] is stepping into his shot,"" said coach Dwane Casey. ""He’s [also] doing a better job getting into the paint, making plays and spraying it out and finding people when they do run him off [the 3-point line]. That’s the next evolution of his game."" Toronto has a nice rest-of-season schedule, with the exception of a two-game Week 24, and Ibaka is heating up at just the right time.
        
        
             
              
             Source: NBA.com                                           Feb 28 - 10:42 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Fred VanVleet
                 
                 
                      - G -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Fred VanVleet had 12 points, three rebounds, three assists and two steals in 27 minutes vs. the Magic on Wednesday.
        
        
             VanVleet was reasonably efficient with 4-of-9 shooting, including three 3-pointers. He's been terrific on a per-minute basis this season and has quietly emerged as a reliable option in 8-cat and 9-cat leagues over the past month, but he's not as appealing in points-leagues due to modest counting stats.
        
        
             
              
             Feb 28 - 10:36 PM

                Career Stats

"Taurean Prince
                 
                 
                      - F -  Hawks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Taurean Prince made 5-of-13 from the field for 15 points with seven rebounds, three assists, two steals, one block and three 3-pointers in 35 minutes against the Pacers during a 107-102 win on Wednesday.
        
        
             Coach Mike Budenholzer praised Prince for handling a larger workload and he was productive yet again today. Prince is going to have a very long leash now that not many Hawks can fill his minutes, so he'll have a big opportunity to produce on the stat sheet. Although, he's going to have some FG% issues.
        
        
             
              
             Source: KL Chouinard on Twitter                           Feb 28 - 10:36 PM

"Jakob Poeltl
                 
                 
                      - C -  Raptors
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jakob Poeltl had another effective game on Wednesday with 13 points (5-of-7 FGs, 3-of-3 FTs), eight rebounds, five assists, three blocks and two steals in 28 minutes.
        
        
             Owners in points-leagues may have barely noticed, but Poeltl is gaining traction as a top-100 value in roto leagues the past month. Despite playing a modest 20.1 minutes per game, he's averaging 7.6 points (72.5% FGs, 90.9% FTs), 4.4 rebounds, 0.9 assists, 1.8 blocks and 0.5 steals in that span. The blocks and percentages are the real draw, so pounce on him if you need a big man.

             The lousy free-throw shooting was abnormal for Lowry, who has really come around lately -- he's dished out 10+ assists in three of his past five games, after failing to crack double-digits for five straight weeks. DeMar DeRozan added 21 points, four assists and three rebounds tonight, and Toronto used another big bench effort to cruise past the Magic.

"Victor Oladipo
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pacers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Victor Oladipo scored 22 points with five rebounds, five assists, six steals, one block and one 3-pointer in 38 minutes during a 107-102 loss to the Hawks on Wednesday.
        
        
             The steals continue to be a huge story for Oladipo and he now has at least one in 44 straight to tie him for the 17th-best streak in NBA history (Jimmy Butler). His six steals today give him a slight edge for the NBA lead in steals per game and he'll likely hold it unless Paul George gets at least three steals tonight. Bad loss aside for the Pacers, Oladipo's fantasy owners got themselves a winning player on the stat sheet tonight.

"Jarrett Jack
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            After picking up a string of DNP-CDs, Jarrett Jack hinted that he may consider pursuing a buyout with the Knicks.
        
        
             ""People have brought it up to me,"" Jack said of a potential buyout. ""I’ve never done it before, to jump from one team in the middle of the season to a playoff squad. I know that’s what other guys have done. To be honest, I don’t really know. Maybe I do need to sit down and look at a list of what my best possible options are. But as of today I’m with the Knicks and want to help in any capacity I can."" Jack isn't worth owning anymore, and changing his jersey won't change that fact.

             ""This is the year. For sure,"" Harden said. ""This is probably the best team I've ever been a part of, from top to bottom. The chemistry that we have, included with the coaching staff -- I mean, we're having a lot of fun."" Not only do the Rockets currently have a 0.5 game advantage over the Warriors for the No. 1 seed out West, but they've also gone 2-1 against the Dubs this season, with their only loss coming when Harden was watching from the sidelines. Yes, they're a legit threat to Oakland.

                Player Outlook

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Marc Gasol
                 
                 
                      - C -  Grizzlies
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marc Gasol acknowledged that all the losing in Memphis this season has been frustrating for him.
        
        
             ""It’s pretty high,"" Gasol said of his frustration level. ""Winning is what this is about. It’s not about somebody playing well or getting your reps or developing players. We have a league [the G League] for that. We have a team here in Memphis to develop guys. This is the NBA, not the [G] League."" With very little help around him, teams have been able to focus most their attention on Gasol, which has resulted in him connecting on a career-low 41.5% of his shot attempts. Unfortunately, no help is coming and with Memphis sitting on an 18-41 record, he'll be in the shutdown discussion.

"Paul Millsap

             He was restricted to 24 minutes tonight, but judging by how he looked, that number could go up pretty quickly. Not many players can stuff a stat sheet like Millsap when he's rolling and he will have early-round upside once his restrictions are gone in a couple weeks, just in time for the fantasy playoffs. Welcome back!

"Boban Marjanovic
                 
                 
                      - C -  Clippers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Boban Marjanovic led the Clippers to a 122-120 comeback win over the Nuggets on Tuesday, scoring 18 points with six rebounds, one assist, two steals and one block.
        
        
             The Clippers were down 82-63 when Boban entered the game with 4:06 left in the third quarter, but the rest is history. The Clippers went to Boban over and over again and the Nuggets didn't have a prayer, as he hit 5-of-8 shots and 8-of-9 free throws while finishing with an absurd +/- rating of +27 in 15 minutes. We're not sure if coach Doc Rivers can justify keeping him out of the rotation following this outburst, so watch this closely the next couple games.

The Greek Freak might be the most appropriate nickname in the league.

"Dario Saric

Saric is still a must-own player and could still hold onto top-75 value the way he's been playing.

             Feb 27 - 10:28 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"LeBron James
                 
                 
                      - F -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            LeBron James hit 13-of-25 shots and two 3-pointers for 31 points, 12 rebounds, 11 assists and a steal, and had just one turnover on a historic night in a 129-123 win over the Nets.
        
        
             LeBron became the first NBA player in history with a career of 30,000 points, 8,000 rebounds and 8,000 assists tonight and was showered with MVP chants. He also became the oldest player (33) to ever average a triple-double in a month, as Wilt Chamberlain was 31 when he did it back in the day. LeBron came into this one averaging 26.6 points, 10.3 rebounds and 10.4 assists for the month of February, and all those numbers went up tonight. And maybe the most interesting stat is that he only had four actual triple-doubles out of his 11 games this month.

This is the first summer I can say I’m just going into the summer and see how I feel and see the position this organization is in and go from there."" Wallace is a very solid dollar per point target industry wide, while Rivers and Harris are both enticing mid-range targets. DeAndre Jordan is also squarely on the DFS radar. Williams is a top option in all formats.

"Paul Millsap
                 
                 
                      - F -  Nuggets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            When asked if he will play Tuesday night vs. the Clippers, Paul Millsap (left wrist surgery) responded: ""We’ll see. Pretty much a game-time decision.""
        
        
             Millsap has a chance to play in his first game since November 19th. However, even if Millsap is active, it's safe to assume that coach Mike Malone will limit his minutes over his first handful of games back in action. Millsap's return will likely bump Will Barton back to the bench, and will reduce Trey Lyles playing time. The Nuggets tip off at 10:30 est tonight, so we can expect an update on Millsap's status at approximately 9:00 pm, when coach Malone addresses the media pregame.
        
        
             Related: Will Barton, Trey Lyles
              
             Source: Chris Dempsey on Twitter                          Feb 27 - 12:57 PM
        
        
        
           
                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Rodney McGruder
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Heat
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            The Heat have recalled Rodney McGruder from their G-League affiliate.
        
        
             McGruder has yet to appear in a game for the Heat this season after undergoing surgery to repair a stress fracture in his left tibia back in mid-October. However, he's been making solid progress and is inching closer to a return. He had 16 points (on 8-of-17 shooting), five rebounds, one assist and no turnovers in 20 minutes on Saturday for the Sioux Falls Skyforce. He will likely be active for Miami shortly, but he should be left on waivers in all fantasy formats, as it is unlikely he'll see consistent minutes with the Heat.

We can expect confirmation on Olynyk's status later this evening, prior to tip-off.

                Player Outlook
                Game Log
                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Rodney Hood
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Coach Ty Lue said that getting Rodney Hood more involved in the Cavs offense will be a priority.
        
        
             Hood averaged 16.8 points on 14.2 field goal attempts with the Jazz this season. However, he is averaging 10.6 points on 9.0 field goal attempts per game with the Cavs. ""We definitely have to get him more touches,"" Lue said of Hood. ""We have to make sure we have a balance of getting the ball in his hands and getting the ball in Jordan [Clarkson]'s hands with that second unit and letting those guys be aggressive. Also at times when he has the ball he has to be aggressive. I think right now he's in between, not sure. But we need him to be aggressive and score the basketball.""

"Frank Ntilikina
                 
                 
                      - G -  Knicks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Coach Jeff Hornacek said that the Knicks expect Frank Ntilikina to play in the Las Vegas Summer League.
        
        
             During All-Star weekend, Ntilikina was asked where he would spend his offseason and he answered ""France."" However, Hornacek said that Frank will likely head back to France once the season ends, but then return to the states later in the summer. The Knicks main objective for Ntilikina is to build strength and get him stronger for his sophomore season.

"Devin Booker
                 
                 
                      - G -  Suns
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Devin Booker went off for 40 points, 10 rebounds, seven assists, one steal and three triples in a 125-116 loss to the Pelicans on Monday.
        
        
             He was 14-of-28 from the field and 9-of-11 from the line, making this the fourth 40-point game of his career and his third career game with double-digit rebounds. Booker has become an offensive superstar this season, but coach Jay Triano said he'd like to see Booker focus a little more on the defensive side as well. ""When I first took over, I thought he was outstanding on the defensive end. Not good. Outstanding,"" Triano said. ""He bought into everything. I think the injuries, the length of the season, he’s drifted a bit and I’ve challenged him to be better now."" Booker said himself that he doesn't want to rest, so he's locked in for a big finish and we'll see if he's up to Triano's challenge.

"Anthony Davis
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Pelicans
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Anthony Davis posted one of the best lines of the season in Monday's 125-116 win over the Suns, scoring a season-high 53 points with 15 rebounds, three assists, one steal, five blocks and one turnover in 39 minutes.
        
        
             He fell just short of his career-high of 59. Davis is the top player in standard fantasy leagues on the season and just pushed himself ahead even further with this monster of a game. He joins Bob McAdoo as the only players with 50 points, 15 rebounds and five blocks in a single game, and this was his third career game with 50+ points and 15+ rebounds -- the rest of the NBA has a combined three of those games in the last 17 years. Please stay healthy.

But he had 21 points and 13 boards on Friday against the Hawks, so hopefully he'll bounce back on Wednesday, when the Pacers get the Hawks again.

"Emmanuel Mudiay

He's a fine option in points formats, but he's a low-end asset in category leagues.

             KCP isn't going away and had his third double-double of the season, and second in his last four games. Harrison's upside is noticeably higher when Evans is out and he's worth starting in standard leagues for the time being -- he gets a 5.1 usage rate bump with Evans off the floor.

Julius Randle was also a beast with 19 points, 10 rebounds, a steal and a block on 8-of-13 shooting.

We can't guarantee that he'll play in March, but you can't leave him on the wire following this report.

             ""Coming back from the All-Star break I was looking forward to playing really well down the stretch,"" said Chandler, who wasn’t able to get through Monday's shootaround. ""So it’s disappointing coming back having to deal with this."" The pain in Chandler's neck has been so severe at times that he hasn't been able to turn his head at all, so it sounds like this thing could turn into an extended absence. Alex Len will continue to start in his absence and is worth a look in deep leagues.RotoGrinders.com Daily Slant: We've been loading up on Len in the three games Chandler has missed, and he hasn't disappointed, posting 46, 37 and 33 fantasy points.              Bell has been targeting a Monday return for some time now, so if all goes well during warmups, he should be able to get back out there following a month-long layoff. Bell will likely be eased back into things, but once he's fully up to speed, there's a decent chance he'll replace JaVale McGee in the starting five.
        
        
             Related: JaVale McGee

             Porter was cruising as a top-40 value while John Wall was healthy, despite having a modest 17.6% usage rate -- the only player with higher fantasy value and lower usage rate in that span was Draymond Green.             Kelly Oubre set a career-high with three blocks in the first half of Sunday's game, finishing with 19 points (6-of-11 FGs, 3-of-4 FTs), four 3-pointers, three assists, two rebounds and one steal.
        
        
             Oubre played 32 minutes without a turnover tonight, and he's averaging 15.7 points on 50.0% shooting in the past three games, despite a miserable slump before the break --
 he was a combined 29.6% from the field in his previous seven games. With a reliable role as the Wizards' default sixth-man, make sure Oubre is owned now that he's knocking down his shots.

"Marcin Gortat
                 
                 
                      - C -  Wizards
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Marcin Gortat got going on Sunday with 13 points on 6-of-11 shooting, 10 rebounds, two assists and one block in 28 minutes of action.
        
        
             The 34-year-old center came in averaging 7.7 points, 7.4 rebounds, 2.7 assists, 0.7 steals and 0.6 blocks in February. He shot 55.0% from the field in that span, but the efficiency is undercut by a lack of volume -- this is the first time since all month that he's attempted more than eight shots. Gortat is clinging to late-round value in 9-cat leagues, due in part to a modest 1.2 turnovers per game, but he doesn't have a lot of upside.

"Robert Covington
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Robert Covington made 2-of-7 field goals and 4-of-4 free throws on Sunday, scoring nine points with two rebounds, two steals, one assist, one 3-pointer and zero turnovers in 30 minutes.
        
        
             Last season, Covington shot 38.3% before the All-Star break but hit 43.7% after the break. This season he's on the opposite trajectory -- he made 44.6% of his attempts in October and November, but hasn't been above 38.4% in the three months since then. The other concern is the arrival of Marco Belinelli. Covington is averaging 28.3 minutes with Belinelli in the lineup, compared to 32.4 minutes prior to Belinelli's arrival. It's a situation worth monitoring closely.

As if his role wasn't chaotic enough, Philly is expected to sign Ersan Ilyasova now that he's been bought out by the Hawks. Barring a rash of injuries in Philly's frontcourt, there's no reason to own Holmes.

"Ben Simmons
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Ben Simmons had 16 points, eight rebounds (four offensive), eight assists, one steal and one block in 37 minutes during Sunday's loss in D.C.
        
        
             Simmons' versatility continues to impress Sixers fans, fantasy owners, and his own teammates and coaches. ""It’s staggering the distance he can cover on limited dribbles,"" said coach Brett Brown. Simmons isn't bashful about his unique skill-set, either, saying recently, ""I’m 6-10, I can pass the ball, I’m fast, I’m strong, I’m quick."" If you ignore his 56.7% free-throw shooting, he's leading the field for rookie fantasy value ahead of fellow ROY candidate Donovan Mitchell.

                      - F/C -  76ers

             It's unclear whether Johnson's absence on Saturday was a precaution in the first half of a back-to-back set, or the Sixers were experimenting with their frontcourt rotations. Trevor Booker logged 23 minutes on Saturday but only nine minutes tonight, and the rotation gets even murkier with Ersan Ilyasova reportedly set to sign with Philly this week. Suffice to say, fantasy owners shouldn't put their faith in Johnson, Booker or Richaun Holmes at any league depth.

"LeBron James
                 
                 
                      - F -  Cavaliers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            LeBron James finished Sunday's tough home loss with 33 points, 13 rebounds and nine assists, going 14-of-25 from the field with a pair of 3-pointers.
        
        
             The Spurs threw the kitchen sink at him with five different defenders in the first half alone, but as usual LeBron continued to do his thing. His efforts were wasted, however, as his fellow starters combined for a mere 14 points on 6-of-28 shooting. Although he fell one dime shy of a triple-double tonight, he still made history by passing Rod Strickland for 11th place all-time in assists (7,988). The best news for fantasy owners is that with Cleveland in the thick of a competitive playoff race, LeBron should be protected from dreaded DNP-rest days.

"Dejounte Murray

            Dejounte Murray filled the boxscore on Sunday with 13 points, nine rebounds, five assists, four steals and three blocks during a 110-94 win vs. Cleveland.
        
        
             Murray scored 10 of his 13 points in the fourth quarter, helping San Antonio close out their 'Rodeo road trip' with a much-needed victory. He's the only point guard in the league with 4+ steals and 3+ blocks in a game this season, which highlights his unique skills and fantasy potential. "Jrue Holiday
                 
                 
                      - G -  Pelicans

             Holiday really struggled through the first half of action, but he dominated the second half and overtime, scoring 26 of his 36 points while rocking a ridiculous 44.6 usage rate. "Nicolas Batum
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Hornets
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Nicolas Batum did a little bit of everything during Sunday's easy win over the Pistons, tallying 15 points, four triples, five boards, nine dimes, three steals, one block and one turnover in 29 minutes.
        
        
             Batum had a nice two-man game going with Dwight Howard, throwing him numerous alley-oops, and overall, he did an excellent job of running the floor racking up six dimes by halftime. He also went 5-of-10 from the field and 1-of-1 from the stripe to give him an elite 71.8 true shooting percentage on the evening, and he probably would have had an even juicier stat line if the game weren't such a blowout.

As an added bonus, he hasn’t missed a single game this year, but with 12 technical to date, he’s just four away from incurring a mandatory one-game suspension.

"Jimmy Butler
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Timberwolves
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Jimmy Butler underwent successful meniscus surgery on his right knee on Sunday, and he's being listed as ""out indefinitely.""
        
        
             The good news is that he hasn't yet been ruled out for the season, and Shams Charania of Yahoo! Sports reported on Saturday that there's a chance Butler could return in 4-6 weeks. We haven't been made aware the exact procedure Butler underwent, but if he is able to return this season that would likely mean he underwent a meniscectomy, which is complete removal of meniscus. Butler will likely be limited upon his return, but a 4-6 week window would give him the opportunity to return during the fantasy playoffs. Andrew Wiggins will be one of the primary beneficiaries here, and Nemanja Bjelica has some deep league appeal as the fill-in starter.
        
        
             Related: Andrew Wiggins, Nemanja Bjelica

"Gordon Hayward
                 
                 
                      - G/F -  Celtics
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Gordon Hayward (leg) isn't ready to travel with the Celtics on road trips yet.
        
        
             According to coach Brad Stevens, the Celtics want Hayward to do more conditioning and strength work on an anti-gravity treadmill before clearing him to travel. ""It doesn’t look like it’s any time in the next couple of weeks,"" Stevens said. ""We talked the other day. He’s gonna do another alter-G process or progress starting on Sunday where he goes from 60 percent of his body weight all the way to 100, and then once he gets to 100 — once he can do stuff where he’s running or jumping, then it makes sense to bring him on the road."" There's been no indication that we'll see Hayward return this season.

             ""Joe Johnson played really well,"" coach Mike D’Antoni said on Friday. ""He’s getting more comfortable, especially in the second half. I’ve known Joe forever and he’s a machine. He just keeps playing, doesn’t get tired, he’s strong, and just really understands his game. If you watch it, he’s really good."" "Dirk Nowitzki
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  Mavericks
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            Dirk Nowitzki said he's planning on playing one more season.
        
        
             ""I signed up last summer for two years,"" Nowitzki said. ""I would love to play next year again. But we’ll kind of see how the rest of the season plays out and how I feel in the summer. But as of now, I want to play again next year. I feel OK. I only missed one game. So the body is holding up OK."" While this is good news, this also gives Dallas even more reason to be careful with him down the stretch.

                Career Stats
                
                  In-season Projections"
"Richaun Holmes
                 
                 
                      - F/C -  76ers
                
                 
            
        
        
        
            76ers coach Brett Brown said he played Richaun Holmes on Saturday to make sure his entire rotation stays engaged.
        
        
             In other words, it's not a lock that he will be used over Amir Johnson again. ""Right now my motivation is I know that Richaun has value, I know that he has things that he can bring to the table and I respect how he’s handled himself when he wasn’t playing that much,"" Brown said. ""I know it’s my job to keep him alive and tonight was an example of that and I thought he did very very well."" Holmes ended up with four points, eight rebounds, four assists, one steal and one block in 21 minutes, and it's almost absurd at this point that Brown has been using Amir Johnson over him this long. We'll see what happens Sunday.
